commit_message:
VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images

This fixes an issue when use_linked_clone is false and the image is
already in the cache.  The problem was that the image would be
copied from glance into the instance directory even if it was already
in the cache.  This change checks if the file is in the cache, only
copies from glance if it is not, and copies the image from the cache
into the instance directory if use_linked_clone is false.

Fixes: bug #1207064
Change-Id: If3a84fda3a2a34f0a4aca3946d0a274f44059eab

commit_message:
Adding Y value unit into linechart popup

- Adding a simplified solution of fetching a meter unit.
- Adding unit into linechart popup, (Rickshaw doesn't support label
  of axis, we may add it in the future, depending on new wireframes).

Fixes bug 1226489

Change-Id: I01aa27578b30e6ad0d27956a3ddd76663f7549ce

commit_message:
Revise peer_address and peer_id definitions

For peer_address, changing to string and removing any
constraint. For both attributes, improved the description.

bug 1225125

Change-Id: I8d36e53588a2a3f0a4857a4f4456f55df35246eb

commit_message:
Neutron ovs plugin should not require vswitch::ovs

I don't see any reason openvswitch components should be required on the same
machine than the neutron ovs *plugin*. It is definitely required for the
neutron ovs *agent* though.

Change-Id: I1d7128f8a79d788b48af4acf504d48a19e8fe12b

commit_message:
Neutron ovs plugin should not require vswitch::ovs

I don't see any reason openvswitch components should be required on the same
machine than the neutron ovs *plugin*. It is definitely required for the
neutron ovs *agent* though.

Conflicts:
	manifests/plugins/ovs.pp

Change-Id: I1d7128f8a79d788b48af4acf504d48a19e8fe12b

commit_message:
Force textmode consoles

Physical hardware often has console interception hardware for OOB
monitoring/management. Prevent the kernel from switching to a graphical
console mode so the hardware can do its job.

Related-Bug: #1178112
Change-Id: If6d36461f3bd4cc3e32877b6810035b5c5ac69f3

commit_message:
Changes documentation hyperlinks to be relative

On the "System Architecture" page of the developer documentation there
are hyperlinks to sections of the API documentation. These hyperlinks
assumed that the documentation has been placed in the web root and
did not work for documentation in a subdirectory. The hyperlinks
were changed to be relative.

Fixes bug: #1206569

Change-Id: Id2bffbeaba1a41f7e9f76f7eb5a849d66703a7e7

commit_message:
Adding multi-node DevStack template for Ubuntu

Adding a template that deploys a multi-node OpenStack installation using
DevStack. This template has been tested on Ubuntu and may work as-is on
Debian too.

Note that the security group resources require to use Neutron and Havana
Heat.

Change-Id: Ibdf4fe7407913f75b2253b09639554c013d31c01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/46/44846/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove _assert_compute_node_has_enough_memory from filter_scheduler.py

Now the function _assert_compute_node_has_enough_memory has no use
in filter_scheduler.py, just remove it to make code more clean.

Change-Id: Ie6f104368140b69a60e124ea96ef6bf7715fe34e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/45873/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _assert_compute_node_has_enough_memory(self, context, instance_ref, dest): """Checks if destination host has enough memory for live migration. :param context: security context :param instance_ref: nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance object :param dest: destination host """ compute = self._get_compute_info(context, dest) node = compute.get('hypervisor_hostname') host_state = self.host_manager.host_state_cls(dest, node) host_state.update_from_compute_node(compute) instance_type = flavors.extract_flavor(instance_ref) filter_properties = {'instance_type': instance_type} hosts = self.host_manager.get_filtered_hosts([host_state], filter_properties, 'RamFilter') if not hosts: instance_uuid = instance_ref['uuid'] reason = (_("Unable to migrate %(instance_uuid)s to %(dest)s: " "Lack of memory") % {'instance_uuid': instance_uuid, 'dest': dest}) raise exception.MigrationPreCheckError(reason=reason)

commit_message:
xenapi: tidy ups to some spawn related methods

There were server methods using during spawn that are only used
internally, but not named that way. They have been renamed in this
change.

There were also several methods that are currently called in a single
place, but had logic around the call that should have been inside that
method. This has been tided up, so it will be easier to re-use and/or
move those calls in future refactoring.

This is one of the building blocks towards sharing more code between
spawn and finish_migration.

Change-Id: I424daf8334ad9904572b9df511d8e6bc1ff6d21f

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-06 14:47:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a65bbb6efa1aa0bfa668ece6577efe657cad2f22', 'message': 'xenapi: move kernel/ramdisk methods to vm_utils

A previous change has now removed the duplication between spawn and
finish_migration, into create_kernel_and_ramdisk. This change moves the
code into vm_utils, and covers the code with some unit tests.

This will makes is easier to share code between spawn and finish_resize
and gives a more logical public interface to vm_utils.

I have also simplified the call to destroy_kernel_ramdisk in spawn so
that can be shared more easily between spawn and finish_migration in a
later change.

Change-Id: I73523d93be0a7afa9fe814af280c582e47064d69

commit_message:
xenapi: move kernel/ramdisk methods to vm_utils

A previous change has now removed the duplication between spawn and
finish_migration, into create_kernel_and_ramdisk. This change moves the
code into vm_utils, and covers the code with some unit tests.

This will makes is easier to share code between spawn and finish_resize
and gives a more logical public interface to vm_utils.

I have also simplified the call to destroy_kernel_ramdisk in spawn so
that can be shared more easily between spawn and finish_migration in a
later change.

Change-Id: I73523d93be0a7afa9fe814af280c582e47064d69

commit_message:
Convert TestCases to NoDBTestCase

NoDBTestCase is faster because it skips initializing a database for
tests which don't actually talk to the database. Its also nicer
because its more explicit about the dependancies of a given test.
This is a first pass at moving test cases over to the database
lacking version, but further work is required here.

Change-Id: Ia28de4ebea4f354cba06bcdc66bb01d4b332943a
Partial-Bug: 1227473

commit_message:
Change daemon Pidfile class to not use root_helper

Some users of the Pidfile class don't specify root_helper,
which then defaults to 'sudo', which will generate an error.
Remove root_helper altogether since we actually don't need
root priveleges to read /proc/$pid/cmdline.

Changed code to use open.readline() instead of a shell, and
tweaked tests accordingly.

Also cleaned-up the rootwrap filters that allow it as they
are not used anymore.

Fixes bug 1218142

Change-Id: I6691feb1c9f7bfa261a7ec464fd8f3f92168c302

commit_message:
Update error messeages in Launch Instance

If no image is selected when launching an instance, we will get
an error message "There are no image sources available; you must
first create an image before attempting to launch an instance."
In most cases this message is displayed when a user forget to
select an image. This commit changes the error message more generic
to avoid unnecessary confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1225755

It also changes the menu to display "No images available" if
no images are available rather than "Selct image" with no choice.

Change-Id: Ie5dd0760349c8b030baa2b2465776d0fa6c1767f

commit_message:
Do not apply security groups to logical ports

Security groups rules were applied to logical ports and this caused
Floating IP not to work correctly.
Correct some typo.

commit_message:
Fix handling of floating IP association info in Nicira plugin

Bug 1223902

This patch fixes the _update_fix_assoc routine in the Nicira plugin,
ensuring the association of a floating IP with a router is removed
when the floating IP is disassociated.
This patch also adds a unit test for validating behaviour when a floating
IP is associated to a port on a different router, which was an
uncovered use case. This new unit test required some refactoring in
test_l3_plugin.py.

Change-Id: Ibfd53a637f4d14a368b0aeff289c15f993df58dd

deleted_lines: if not router_id and floatingip_db.get('fixed_port_id'): # This happens if we're disassociating. Need to explicitly # find the router serving this floating IP tmp_fip = fip.copy() tmp_fip['port_id'] = floatingip_db['fixed_port_id'] _pid, internal_ip, router_id = self.get_assoc_data( context, tmp_fip, floatingip_db['floating_network_id']) # If there's no association router_id will be None if router_id: self._retrieve_and_delete_nat_rules(floating_ip, internal_ip, router_id) # Fetch logical port of router's external gateway nvp_floating_ips = self._build_ip_address_list( context.elevated(), external_port['fixed_ips']) LOG.debug(_("Address list for NVP logical router " "port:%s"), nvp_floating_ips) if 'port_id' in fip and fip['port_id']: elif floatingip_db['fixed_port_id']: # This is a disassociation. # Remove floating IP address from logical router port internal_ip = None nvplib.update_lrouter_port_ips(self.cluster, router_id, nvp_gw_port_id, ips_to_add=[], ips_to_remove=nvp_floating_ips)

commit_message:
Bugfix for ConfigManagers: defauls overwriting

In the previos version the read_from_dict() method of the test ConfigManager
classes did not overwrite the already existing options by default, which
resulted in the incorrect TestEngine.bind() behavious. This patch fixes this
issue, adds comments to the ConfigManager class and also makes one small
styllistic improvement in TestConfigManager.

Change-Id: Ie5943e6837405719694659d93912b6153601f878
Closes-Bug: #1227864
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/64/47464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """ Initializes the config manager with the default values and (if given) with a config. :param config: Path to the config file or a two-level dictionary containing the config contents """ def read_from_dict(self, dct, transform=str, replace=True): """ Reads the config from a dictionary. :param dct: The config represented as a two-level dictionary: the top-level keys should be section names while the keys on the second level should represent option names :param transform: Function that will be applied to all the config values: it should take a string as its only argument and produce the result that will be stored in the ConfigManager instance :param replace: True to replace already existing options while reading the config; False to keep old values """ self.read_from_dict(self._DEFAULT_CLOUD_CONFIG, replace=False) def read_from_dict(self, dct, transform=json.dumps, replace=True): super(TestConfigManager, self).read_from_dict(dct, transform, replace)
deleted_lines: def read_from_dict(self, dct, transform=str, replace=False): self.read_from_dict(self._DEFAULT_CLOUD_CONFIG) def read_from_dict(self, dct): super(TestConfigManager, self).read_from_dict(dct, json.dumps)

commit_message:
Add DIB_IMAGE_CACHE

DIB_IMAGE_CACHE will be a user override for the location where images
are cached. Default location is ~/.cache/image-create

Change-Id: I3e9b9f970864d555c9ec9436344b53f6d3d66dfa

commit_message:
Typo: certicates=>certificates in nova.conf

The help message for cinder_ca_certificates_file and
neutron_ca_certificates_file spelled certificates wrong.

As this is user facing, we should fix it.

Fixes bug 1227780

Change-Id: If9372fffb655d21069c005351ebb593d8e16e056

subject: MultiprocessWSGITest wait for workers to die bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-12 03:51:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a4a95a80ae4ee3ae04b57da47a029f5395e3fafd', 'message': 'MultiprocessWSGITest wait for workers to die bug.

MultiprocessWSGITest.test_terminate_sigterm
fails because the wait for workers to die is unreliable.

Parent process can now wait on child or grand-child
processes to complete before moving on. This allows
for grand-child (aka worker) processes to take as much
time as they need to shutdown. NOTE: If the processes
still take too long, they will be killed by the test
framework throwing the "TIMEOUT" exception.

Reverts to using a ping signal to child process
to determine if the child process is live. Waits for
the signal call to fail, signaling process death.

closes bug #1218133

commit_message:
MultiprocessWSGITest wait for workers to die bug

MultiprocessWSGITest.test_terminate_sigterm
fails because the wait for workers to die is unreliable.

Parent process can now wait on child or grand-child
processes to complete before moving on. This allows
for grand-child (aka worker) processes to take as much
time as they need to shutdown. NOTE: If the processes
still take too long, they will be killed by the test
framework throwing the "TIMEOUT" exception.

Reverts to using a ping signal to child process
to determine if the child process is live. Waits for
the signal call to fail, signaling process death.

closes bug #1218133

Change-Id: I08e17005508fe412f462773f9ab212cf0f10382f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/46184/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info('waiting on process %r to exit' % worker_pid) polling = True while polling: # poll the process until it isn't there to poll try: os.kill(worker_pid, 0) time.sleep(0.1) except OSError, err: # we don't get a return value from kill, so we have # to watch for the exception. Another mechanism # could use a handler for signal.SIGCHILD that # counted the number of calls to it. if err.errno == errno.ESRCH: polling = False
deleted_lines: status = -1 try: pid, status = os.waitpid(worker_pid, 0) except OSError as err: # if the kill command is too fast... if err.errno == errno.ESRCH: # the process is already dead... or... return status elif err.errno == errno.ECHILD: # the child may have exited early! return status else: # the unexpected may still happen raise return status

commit_message:
Enable fake driver can live migration

Now two methods of virt/fake.py does not implemented
1) ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance
2) unfilter_instance

Also the method live_migration does not call
post_live_migration_at_destination, this will cause compute
driver has no chance to update task state for the VM in DB.

Fix bug 1223090

Change-Id: I2fe552faa5f73b47b97e8fefc5c4de04d6785f8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/45882/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: """This method is supported only by libvirt.""" raise NotImplementedError('This method is supported only by libvirt.')

commit_message:
Wrong arguments when calling safe_utils.getcallargs()

When calling safe_utils.getcallargs(), it will get all argnames from
definition of a function. As every function in Nova has a argument named
`context`, so argnames will always start with `context`.

In nova/exception.py#81, *args is a list of arguments which does not
start with
`context`, however, argnames starts with `context`, this will lead to a
mismatching when zip it into a dict.

Solution for this is that when calling getcallargs(), pass context as
one argument.

Change-Id: I4ce81e1862fb2d741f15747b04aa6bf1a2243364
Fixes: bug #1207153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/39633/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: call_dict = safe_utils.getcallargs(f, context, *args, **kw)

added_lines: # Copyright 2013 OpenStack LLC. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import cStringIO import sys from ironicclient.common import utils from ironicclient.tests import utils as test_utils class UtilsTest(test_utils.BaseTestCase): def test_prettytable(self): class Struct: def __init__(self, **entries): self.__dict__.update(entries) # test that the prettytable output is wellformatted (left-aligned) saved_stdout = sys.stdout try: sys.stdout = output_dict = cStringIO.StringIO() utils.print_dict({'K': 'k', 'Key': 'Value'}) finally: sys.stdout = saved_stdout self.assertEqual(output_dict.getvalue(), '''\ +----------+-------+ | Property | Value | +----------+-------+ | K | k | | Key | Value | +----------+-------+ ''') def test_args_array_to_dict(self): my_args = { 'matching_metadata': ['metadata.key=metadata_value'], 'other': 'value' } cleaned_dict = utils.args_array_to_dict(my_args, "matching_metadata") self.assertEqual(cleaned_dict, { 'matching_metadata': {'metadata.key': 'metadata_value'}, 'other': 'value' })

commit_message:
Creates multiple worker processes for API server

This change to the WSGI code uses openstack.common.service to create
multiple worker processes to handle API load.  The main process will
start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

Change-Id: I1d9b183e1ad8d172584e83ae67524e505e0f425f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/47202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor threshold evaluator

This change creates a base class for evaluator.

The alarm service load all evaluators.
A evaluator needs to implement abstract method of this base class.

The alarm service now check in alarm.type use the right extension to
evaluate the alarm.

The previous threshold evaluator code has been moved into the threshold
extension.

Related to blueprint alarming-logical-combination

Change-Id: If6057b7db1e894333e6e9f1edb41ab75bc2c4444

commit_message:
Manager._list should always return a list

Convert single-row result sets to dicts for consistent
handling of single-element lists.

Change-Id: I2fc88743f8cee0112211cd837bbfcb7d95753d3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/02/47302/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not isinstance(data, list): data = [data]

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2013-09-04 21:19:02.000000000', 'files': ['trove/extensions/security_group/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/e89cd36f30159699e6e3be6b5905637ad7569630', 'message': "Security Group Rule's To/From/Protocol Ignored

A Security Group Rule can be created via the CLI like so:

$ trove-cli secgroup add_rule --secgroup_id 2263 --protocol tcp \
    --from_port 88 --to_port 88 --cidr 0.0.0.0/0

From the blueprint (bp/security-groups), it seems the intent was to
support multiple rules for a security group. However, the add_rule
method completely disregards the from_port, to_port, and protocol
values, instead opting for the defaults set in the CONF.

Changes:

- All add_rule arguments are now required (no defaults)
- Schema validation is now enabled for add_rule (prior to this
  changeset, the validation was never ran due to the 'create' action
  missing in the schema)
- to_port/from_port validation has been enhanced to detect invalid
  ranges, as well as support regex approved numeric strings.

Closes-Bug: #1199623
Change-Id: I7466046c4641c22e5be30467e68953e0e0582fa6
"}]
commit_message:
Security Group Rule's To/From/Protocol Ignored

A Security Group Rule can be created via the CLI like so:

$ trove-cli secgroup add_rule --secgroup_id 2263 --protocol tcp \
    --from_port 88 --to_port 88 --cidr 0.0.0.0/0

From the blueprint (bp/security-groups), it seems the intent was to
support multiple rules for a security group. However, the add_rule
method completely disregards the from_port, to_port, and protocol
values, instead opting for the defaults set in the CONF.

Changes:

- All add_rule arguments are now required (no defaults)
- Schema validation is now enabled for add_rule (prior to this
  changeset, the validation was never ran due to the 'create' action
  missing in the schema)
- to_port/from_port validation has been enhanced to detect invalid
  ranges, as well as support regex approved numeric strings.

Closes-Bug: #1199623
Change-Id: I7466046c4641c22e5be30467e68953e0e0582fa6

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/alarm-api

It allows to create differente kind of alarm.
The current kind of alarm has been named 'threshold'.

It move defaults value from the storage models to the API
with all tools provided by wsme to ensure mandatory field and default.

A behaviors change, it now mandatory to PUT a full alarm description
PUT call.
In the futur a new endpoint can be added to allow to modify only one
field (example for state: /v2/alarms/<id>/state)

Implements blueprint alarming-logical-combination

commit_message:
Alarm API update

This updates the alarm API to match the latest discussion:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/alarm-api

It allows creation of different kinds of alarm.
The current kind of alarm has been named 'threshold'.

It move the defaults values from the storage models to the API
with all tools provided by wsme to ensure mandatory field and default.

A behavior change, it is now mandatory to PUT a full alarm description
in a PUT call.
In the future a new endpoint can be added to allow to modify only one
field (example for state: /v2/alarms/<id>/state)

Implements blueprint alarming-logical-combination

Change-Id: Ib85636728d427cdb70ef530ff9ff20d2b75c5ed1

When a new GRE tunnel is created OVS agent calls ovs-vsctl
incorrectly. Command:

    sudo ovs-vsctl --timeout=2 --may-exist add-port br-tun gre-1

is produced instead of correct one:

Fixes bug 1227675

'}]
commit_message:
Fix ovs-vsctl call in add_tunnel_port()

When a new GRE tunnel is created OVS agent calls ovs-vsctl
incorrectly. Command:

    sudo ovs-vsctl --timeout=2 --may-exist add-port br-tun gre-1

is produced instead of correct one:

   sudo ovs-vsctl --timeout=2 -- --may-exist add-port br-tun gre-1

Fixes bug 1227675

Change-Id: I010961658a37028e41621c4a529b5a14e7587c7f

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-09-19 17:21:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cc9530ee21724ae5075909408f5594f2d7777513', 'message': 'Send update notification for updates to instance objects

Before objects, a notification would be sent for any change to an
instance and the notifications.send_update method would handle any
filtering that needed to be done prior to sending the event.

Currently, the instance objects code is pre-filtering the notification
by only checking if vm_state or task_state changed which is a

the notifications.send_update method handle the event as it did before.

instance and the notifications.send_update method would handle any
filtering that needed to be done prior to sending the event.

Currently, the instance objects code is pre-filtering the notification
by only checking if vm_state or task_state changed which is a

Change-Id: Ib6ceedfe55b021be0fe7fa910e97d46c0cd8f0cd
'}]
commit_message:
Send notification for any updates to instance objects

Before objects, a notification would be sent for any change to an
instance and the notifications.send_update method would handle any
filtering that needed to be done prior to sending the event.

Currently, the instance objects code is pre-filtering the notification
by only checking if vm_state or task_state changed which is a
regression.

This patch removes the filter in the instance objects code so that
notifications are again sent for any changes to the instance and lets
the notifications.send_update method handle the event as it did before.

Closes-Bug: #1220186

Change-Id: Ib6ceedfe55b021be0fe7fa910e97d46c0cd8f0cd

commit_message:
Add tripleo-incubator to pull-tools.

Adds the tripleo-incubator git repository to pull-tools.
Makes it easier to pull updates for all git repositories
used in devtest in one step.

commit_message:
Retry on deadlock in instance_metadata_delete

Add the retry_on_deadlock decorator to the instance_metadata_delete
function in the sqlalchemy db API.  A tempest test failure shows that it
would benefit from it.

Change-Id: I39547fbbbabc310b78493df0dc055bc320995770
Closes-bug: #1226076

commit_message:
Provide Neutron password in compute metadata

overcloud compute node makes requests to Neutron API
and requires quantum_admin_password option of nova.conf
to be set (it is defined in nova image element like
quantum_admin_password={{neutron.service-password}}).

Without this, booting of a user instance in overcloud
fails, because nova-compute service can't authorize
requests to Neutron API.

Change-Id: Ie726d0c3d54abc6c24a45fde3f5af03fd2cf9e37

commit_message:
Use openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch for update method

image.patch returns a JSON schema Draft 10 (application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch)
while the glaceclient update method specify a Content-Type header
application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch with correspond to a JSON schemea Draft 4.

Fixes bug 1206095
Change-Id: I8c5a96f0e117a81b5b527a96ef45758fc69b518d

commit_message:
perf: Partition messages collection by project

This patch moves the project name out of the individual message documents
by creating per-project message collections instead. This reduces
the size and complexity of message indexes, as well as increasing the
performance of queries. Furthermore, it will make it more likely that
collections and associated indexes for busy projects are retained in
RAM when memory pressure forces paging.

Change-Id: I3c6a4937cc5735866c108c5a3323a3ea03553773
Implements: blueprint partition-messages-collection

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for os-host/{host-name} api

Add tempest tests for nova api 'os-host/{host-name}' which is used
to expose detail host information such cpu/memory/disk.

Change-Id: I7e164c9f584ce70d6bd467575dc1798f0a53bcee

added_lines: from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name @attr(type='gate') def test_show_host_detail(self): resp, hosts = self.client.list_hosts() self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue(len(hosts) >= 1) hostname = hosts[0]['host_name'] resp, detail_host = self.client.show_host_detail(hostname) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) host_resource = detail_host['resource'] self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['cpu']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['disk_gb']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['memory_mb']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['host']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['project']) @attr(type='negative') def test_show_host_detail_with_nonexist_hostname(self): hostname = rand_name('rand_hostname') self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.show_host_detail(hostname))

commit_message:
Neutron nicira plugin: set up connectivity with public network

When spinning devstack with the Neutron and the Nicira plugin, the public
bridge is not configured since the external network will be implemented
on the NVP gateway appliance.

This patch therefore configures an IP address for the devstack interface
on the NVP gateway's uplink network thus providing IP connectivity with
the Neutron external network configured by devstack.
The configured IP address is the external network's gateway, in
accordance with similar setting for OVS-based plugins.

This patch also ensures the IP address is configured when devstack
is shut down.

Bug #1227757

Change-Id: I971eb75548af23c2c77506d48eabd49f2ddb7348

added_lines: NVP_GATEWAY_UPLINK_INTERFACE=${NVP_GATEWAY_UPLINK_INTERFACE:-eth0}# Re-declare floating range as it's needed also in stop_nicira, which # is invoked by unstack.sh FLOATING_RANGE=${FLOATING_RANGE:-172.24.4.224/28}function _public_gateway_ip_with_prefix() { # NOTE: This info cannot be retrieve from neutron as at this stage it has not yet started # The following command will populate public_cidr and public_gateway_ip variables echo $PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY/${FLOATING_RANGE#*/} } function start_nicira() { # Configure public network gateway IP on interface on NVP gateway's uplink network if ! is_service_enabled q-l3 && [[ "$Q_L3_ENABLED" == "True" ]]; then ip_to_set=$(_public_gateway_ip_with_prefix) sudo ip addr add $ip_to_set dev $NVP_GATEWAY_UPLINK_INTERFACE fi # Always try to unconfigure public network gateway ip ip_to_remove=$(_public_gateway_ip_with_prefix) sudo ip addr del $ip_to_remove dev $NVP_GATEWAY_UPLINK_INTERFACE

commit_message:

Fixes bug #1226736

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-12 23:06:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/33c93cefa043b8b3d6db6d6f9055ad508374fd42', 'message': "Move iterator creation into loop

When retrieving compute node stats, only the first node's stats were being
retrieved. This was caused by an interator being created outside of the nested
loops.

To handle this, we need to construct a fresh iterator each time before the
inner loop is executed.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-14 07:27:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9956549c91872280ce8b323ef759868af254263b', 'message': "Add more test cases showing cascaded stat deletes

The respective bug report claims that deleting either a compute node or
compute service does not cause cascaded soft deletes of the compute node stats.

As such, this commit provides two new test cases that illustrate that the
compute node stats are indeed soft deleted when the db_api's compute node
or service deletion routines are invoked. Additionally, the conductor calls the
same APIs as well, so we should be covered there in terms of what these new
test cases are proving.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67
Closes-Bug: #1224712
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-09-14 09:12:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e6cdbaf6cc8a1459be4929270b930584138ba3e6', 'message': "WIP: Prune node stats at compute node delete time

This is a work in progress.

This commit addresses the situation in which a compute node is deleted, but
its compute node stats still remain in the database as **not** deleted. This
causes ill side effects in compute_node_get_all when it's retrieving host stats
as it doesn't expect there to be compute node stats for which there is no
corresponding compute node (i.e., causing some node's stats to be empty).

As such, when a compute node is deleted, its stats should also be implicitly
deleted.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67
Closes-Bug: #1224712

commit_message:
Prune node stats at compute node delete time

This commit addresses the situation in which a compute node is deleted, but
its compute node stats still remain in the database as **not** deleted. This
causes ill side effects in compute_node_get_all when it's retrieving host stats
as it doesn't expect there to be compute node stats for which there is no
corresponding compute node (i.e., causing some nodes' stats to be empty).

As such, when a compute node is deleted, its stats should also be implicitly
deleted.

The new test case that's been created fails without the code changes, which
illustrates the problem that compute node stats are empty when they should
not be.

Also included is a simple DB migration script that will update old stats that
were not marked soft-deleted as they should have been.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67
Closes-Bug: #1224712
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/46379/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for nid, nsts in itertools.groupby(stats, lambda s: s['compute_node_id']): # NOTE(jwcroppe): Reset the iterator (bug 1224712) compute_nodes_iter = iter(compute_nodes)
deleted_lines: compute_nodes_iter = iter(compute_nodes) for nid, nsts in itertools.groupby(stats, lambda s: s['compute_node_id']):

commit_message:
Add keystone user-update test

* add method update_user for identity_client
* add method test_update_user for UserTestJSON

Change-Id: I895c4fa2924c215f0cdbbb073f637ea4e8a5823f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/77/46477/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_user(self): # Test case to check if updating of user attributes is successful. self.data.setup_test_tenant() resp, user = self.client.create_user(self.alt_user, self.alt_password, self.data.tenant['id'], self.alt_email) self.data.users.append(user) # Updating user details with new values u_name2 = rand_name('user2-') u_email2 = u_name2 + '@testmail.tm' resp, update_user = self.client.update_user(user['id'], name=u_name2, email=u_email2, enabled=False) # Assert response body of update user. self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(u_name2, update_user['name']) self.assertEqual(u_email2, update_user['email']) self.assertEqual('false', str(update_user['enabled']).lower()) # GET by id after updating resp, new_user_get = self.client.get_user(user['id']) # Assert response body of GET after updating self.assertEqual(u_name2, new_user_get['name']) self.assertEqual(u_email2, new_user_get['email']) self.assertEqual('false', str(new_user_get['enabled']).lower()) @attr(type='smoke')

commit_message:
Updates documentation for tox use

In order to create a virtualenv with tox, a postgresql package is needed
as a prerequisite. The dev-quickstart documentation has been updated to
reflect this.

In addition, the prerequisites for Fedora/RHEL were modified, because
mysql-devel is needed, not mysql-libs.

Fixes bug: #1227390

Change-Id: Ibfdb0a9a3d560fcc3fb7d95aaa1d765ed18215e2

commit_message:
Addition of volume/snapshot_metadata CLI

Added below CLIs:-
1. Set or Delete metadata on a snapshot
2. Show metadata of a snapshot
3. Show metadata of a volume

Change-Id: Ib9bd56f51028889b15de75d69f340328cde31a75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/16/47416/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_snapshot_metadata_set(self): self.run_command('snapshot-metadata 1234 set key1=val1 key2=val2') self.assert_called('POST', '/snapshots/1234/metadata', {'metadata': {'key1': 'val1', 'key2': 'val2'}}) def test_snapshot_metadata_unset_dict(self): self.run_command('snapshot-metadata 1234 unset key1=val1 key2=val2') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/snapshots/1234/metadata/key1') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/snapshots/1234/metadata/key2', pos=-2) def test_snapshot_metadata_unset_keys(self): self.run_command('snapshot-metadata 1234 unset key1 key2') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/snapshots/1234/metadata/key1') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/snapshots/1234/metadata/key2', pos=-2) def test_snapshot_metadata_show(self): self.run_command('snapshot-metadata-show 1234') self.assert_called('GET', '/snapshots/1234/metadata') def test_volume_metadata_show(self): self.run_command('metadata-show 1234') self.assert_called('GET', '/volumes/1234/metadata')

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from ironicclient.common import utils from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as ksclient def _get_ksclient(**kwargs): """Get an endpoint and auth token from Keystone. :param kwargs: keyword args containing credentials: * username: name of user * password: user's password * auth_url: endpoint to authenticate against * insecure: allow insecure SSL (no cert verification) * tenant_{name|id}: name or ID of tenant """ return ksclient.Client(username=kwargs.get('username'), password=kwargs.get('password'), tenant_id=kwargs.get('tenant_id'), tenant_name=kwargs.get('tenant_name'), auth_url=kwargs.get('auth_url'), insecure=kwargs.get('insecure')) def _get_endpoint(client, **kwargs): """Get an endpoint using the provided keystone client.""" return client.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=kwargs.get('service_type') or 'ironic', endpoint_type=kwargs.get('endpoint_type') or 'publicURL') def get_client(api_version, **kwargs): """Get an authtenticated client, based on the credentials in the keyword args. :param api_version: the API version to use ('1' or '2') :param kwargs: keyword args containing credentials, either: * os_auth_token: pre-existing token to re-use * ironic_url: ironic API endpoint or: * os_username: name of user * os_password: user's password * os_auth_url: endpoint to authenticate against * insecure: allow insecure SSL (no cert verification) * os_tenant_{name|id}: name or ID of tenant """ if kwargs.get('os_auth_token') and kwargs.get('ironic_url'): token = kwargs.get('os_auth_token') endpoint = kwargs.get('ironic_url') elif (kwargs.get('os_username') and kwargs.get('os_password') and kwargs.get('os_auth_url') and (kwargs.get('os_tenant_id') or kwargs.get('os_tenant_name'))): ks_kwargs = { 'username': kwargs.get('os_username'), 'password': kwargs.get('os_password'), 'tenant_id': kwargs.get('os_tenant_id'), 'tenant_name': kwargs.get('os_tenant_name'), 'auth_url': kwargs.get('os_auth_url'), 'service_type': kwargs.get('os_service_type'), 'endpoint_type': kwargs.get('os_endpoint_type'), 'insecure': kwargs.get('insecure'), } _ksclient = _get_ksclient(**ks_kwargs) token = ((lambda: kwargs.get('os_auth_token')) if kwargs.get('os_auth_token') else (lambda: _ksclient.auth_token)) endpoint = kwargs.get('ironic_url') or \ _get_endpoint(_ksclient, **ks_kwargs) cli_kwargs = { 'token': token, 'insecure': kwargs.get('insecure'), 'timeout': kwargs.get('timeout'), 'ca_file': kwargs.get('ca_file'), 'cert_file': kwargs.get('cert_file'), 'key_file': kwargs.get('key_file'), } return Client(api_version, endpoint, **cli_kwargs) def Client(version, *args, **kwargs): module = utils.import_versioned_module(version, 'client') client_class = getattr(module, 'Client') return client_class(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fixes undercloud and overcloud credentials

renames TOCI_UNDERCLOUD|OVERCLOUD_PASSWORD to UNDERCLOUD|OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD
because these variables are expected to be set in undercloudrc and overcloudrc files.

Change-Id: I9947662b38d94c41bcfdb32e7c481f95e92bc47a

commit_message:
Prevent updates while state change is in progress

This patch will prevent clients to update a node while its transitioning
from one state to another.

Change-Id: I3395916b5f9be3f6a5b6d7e6d92dd9353217d4d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/46506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Prevent node from being updated when there's a state # change in progress if any(node_obj.get(tgt) for tgt in ["target_power_state", "target_provision_state"]): raise exception.NodeStateInProgress(node=node_id)

commit_message:
Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Fixes bug #1226374

Change-Id: I6ba14f94d49e071c4d2208f946befca915c83d53

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I05f042dc247ac117f6c2823d1326a88059875b79

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from oslo

Some Messages, such as those created from Invalid exceptions, use a
Message within a Message, and we were only translating the base Message
but not the Message substitution within.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/76/47276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This is useful if your project is importing _ directly instead of using the gettextutils.install() way of importing the _ function. """ global USE_LAZY USE_LAZY = True if USE_LAZY: return Message(msg, 'neutron') else: return _t.ugettext(msg)class Message(_userString.UserString, object): self._locale = None @property def locale(self): return self._locale @locale.setter def locale(self, value): self._locale = value if not self.params: return # This Message object may have been constructed with one or more # Message objects as substitution parameters, given as a single # Message, or a tuple or Map containing some, so when setting the # locale for this Message we need to set it for those Messages too. if isinstance(self.params, Message): self.params.locale = value return if isinstance(self.params, tuple): for param in self.params: if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value return for param in self.params.values(): if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value 'domain', 'params', '_locale'] return _userString.UserString.__getattribute__(self, name) if domain in _AVAILABLE_LANGUAGES: return copy.copy(_AVAILABLE_LANGUAGES[domain]) language_list = ['en_US'] language_list.append(i) _AVAILABLE_LANGUAGES[domain] = language_list return copy.copy(language_list) if isinstance(message, Message):

commit_message:
Add update-volume test

* change method _volume_create_get_delete for VolumesGetTest
* add method update_volume for VolumesClientJSON & VolumesClientXML

Change-Id: I71c2a0e1979767ffe453baf7e3b86e378725906c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/47100/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _volume_create_get_update_delete(self, **kwargs): # Update Volume new_v_name = rand_name('new-Volume') new_desc = 'This is the new description of volume' resp, update_volume = \ self.client.update_volume(volume['id'], display_name=new_v_name, display_description=new_desc) # Assert response body for update_volume method self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(new_v_name, update_volume['display_name']) self.assertEqual(new_desc, update_volume['display_description']) # Assert response body for get_volume method resp, updated_volume = self.client.get_volume(volume['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(volume['id'], updated_volume['id']) self.assertEqual(new_v_name, updated_volume['display_name']) self.assertEqual(new_desc, updated_volume['display_description']) self.assertEqual(metadata, updated_volume['metadata']) if 'imageRef' in kwargs: self.assertEqual(updated_volume['bootable'], True) if 'imageRef' not in kwargs: self.assertEqual(updated_volume['bootable'], False) def test_volume_create_get_update_delete(self): self._volume_create_get_update_delete() def test_volume_create_get_update_delete_from_image(self): self._volume_create_get_update_delete(imageRef=self.config.compute.image_ref) def test_volume_create_get_update_delete_as_clone(self): self._volume_create_get_update_delete(source_volid=origin['id'])
deleted_lines: def _volume_create_get_delete(self, **kwargs): def test_volume_create_get_delete(self): self._volume_create_get_delete() def test_volume_create_get_delete_from_image(self): self._volume_create_get_delete(imageRef=self.config.compute.image_ref) def test_volume_create_get_delete_as_clone(self): self._volume_create_get_delete(source_volid=origin['id'])

commit_message:
Dump basic network info  in the test_network_basic_ops

Add minimal debug debug capability for basic network informations,
These information, especially the nat rules in the router namespaces
 usually very helpful.

Change-Id: I8840cb5e388fc8b674b66f8de4e25754ccbe0863

commit_message:
Add warning and workaround for selinux

Building a Fedora image from an Ubuntu guest runs into DIB bug
1204824. This provides a workaround until the DIB bug is resolved.

Change-Id: I1a4171d6f833b8989e19229fbe63f7a10011a95b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/64/47364/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: platform=$(head -1 /etc/os-release) if [ $platform = 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; thenelif [ $platform = 'NAME=Fedora' ]; then# Workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1204824 if [ $platform = 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; then echo "**************************************************************" echo "WARNING: As a workaround for DIB bug 1204824, you are about to" echo " create a Fedora image that has SELinux disabled. Do " echo " not use this image in production. " echo "**************************************************************" fedora_elements_sequence="$fedora_elements_sequence selinux-permissive" fedora_image_name="$fedora_image_name.selinux-permissive" fi

added_lines: class mystring(str): pass class mydict(dict): pass def annotated(test_name, test_input): r = mystring(test_input) setattr(r, "__name__", test_name) return r annotated('test_insert_queue_long_name', 'i' * 64)) @ddt.data('', '@$@^qw', annotated('test_insert_queue_invalid_name_length', 'i' * 65)) def annotated(test_name, test_input): r = mydict(test_input) setattr(r, "__name__", test_name) return r annotated('test_insert_queue_metadata_huge', {"queue": "i" * 65000})) @ddt.data('not_a_dict', annotated('test_insert_queue_invalid_metadata_huge', {"queue": "i" * 65537}))

commit_message:
Adds drivers for marconi proxy storage

This adds a mongodb and a memory storage driver for managing a marconi
proxy catalogue. The memory driver is used by default, though it is
only suitable for testing purposes.

Requests are now also round-robin'd properly, rather than set once
based on queue.

Unit tests were added that give significant coverage of current and
future proxy storage driver implementations. These mirror the
conventions established by tests/unit/queues/storage, and add a
configuration file 'etc/wsgi_proxy_mongodb.conf'. The 'marconi_proxy'
DB is used by default.

Four new test helpers are introduced, all context_managers
- entry
- entries
- partition
- partitions

BREAKING CHANGE: proxy.utils.node
* rewrote weighted_select to be more functional, storage-independent
* rewrote round_robin to be more functional, storage-independent
* rationale: so that storage drivers can use this as needed

BREAKING CHANGE: removed caching
BREAKING CHANGE: removed round robin index from storage
BREAKING CHANGE: proxy.utils.helpers
* removed cruft functions
* updated forward to require only host and request

BREAKING CHANGE: storage interface
* updated to reflect actual usage of storage controllers

This patchset also updates the app and all resources to use the new
storage controllers.

Also fixes various resource bugs:
- nodes -> hosts
- try/except on catalogue entries -> NotFound
- sort memory storage listing by queue name / partition name

Change-Id: If628f5ac74a340f613b65b695d72a62de5453566
Implements: blueprint placement-service

commit_message:
Fix Cluster Template name

When Cluster Template is being uploaded, name is passed through URL.

Plugin SPI has been slightly modified to accept 'template_name' parameter

Fixes bug: #1206252

Change-Id: I796e6c150c067d527c82eab0ec2ca930384c3fd7

commit_message:
VMware driver: Fix for invalid datastore selection

Added filter to ignore datastores that are not mounted, in-accessible
and read-only for volume creation. Without this VMware's VC/ESX driver can
choose such datastore with higher invalid capacity value as returned by the
server for volume creation.

Also using parent's self.mox object in the test cases rather than creating
a new mox.Mox obj everytime.

Fixes bug: 1220217

Change-Id: If8319562ddc11fc31eb928b3807aead2b11b94bc

commit_message:
remove VolumeNotFoundForInstance class

VolumeNotFoundForInstance class is used only in test_xiv_ds8k.py.  I
think the exception class that is used only in test code should not be
defined in cinder/exception.py.

Change-Id: I53512d9b06d48e1fb98ef63eac82c033cec37471
Closes-Bug: #1227477

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from oslo

Some Messages, such as those created from Invalid exceptions, use a
Message within a Message, and we were only translating the base Message
but not the Message substitution within.

Also adds test case for cinder case.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf

added_lines: 'message': translate(explanation, locale)}}def translate(translatable, locale): """Translates the translatable Message to the given locale. :param translatable: the object to be translated :param locale: the locale to translate to :returns: the translated object, or the object as-is if it was not translated """ localize = gettextutils.get_localized_message if ((isinstance(translatable, gettextutils.Message)) and translatable.params): for param in translatable.params: # Translate the Message replacement elements in this Message replacement = translatable.params[param] translatable.params[param] = localize(replacement, locale) return localize(translatable, locale) locale = request.best_match_language() translate(self.content['overLimitFault']['message'], locale) translate(self.content['overLimitFault']['details'], locale)

commit_message:
Remove print statement from test_quotas that fails H233 check

The nova.tests.objects.test_quotas module had a print statement which is
causing a hacking H233 check failure. It was probably just left there
from debugging the code while it was under development, so this patch
simply removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1227655

Change-Id: I25296d7f4a9d2242bfe3ed2e00df6d840a7b19cd

Added validation for 'default_image_id' field for cluster create

Fixed old tests without 'default_image_id' provided.

commit_message:
FWaaS - fix reordering of rules in policy

Due to a recent change, reodering of rules within the
same policy was failing. This is fixed by checking if
the rules belong to the same policy we allow reordering.

There was also a missing call to reorder due to which
the position number on the rules was not reflected correctly
after the reordering. This is also fixed.

Closes bug: #1226941

Change-Id: I7f52e8b9d578c290ace3bb615bf68bd213398303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/47088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setUp(self, core_plugin=None, fw_plugin=None): self.plugin = importutils.import_object(fw_plugin) ext_mgr = api_ext.PluginAwareExtensionManager( extensions_path, {constants.FIREWALL: self.plugin} ) app = config.load_paste_app('extensions_test_app') self.ext_api = api_ext.ExtensionMiddleware(app, ext_mgr=ext_mgr) def test_update_firewall_policy_reorder_rules(self): attrs = self._get_test_firewall_policy_attrs() with self.firewall_policy() as fwp: with contextlib.nested(self.firewall_rule(name='fwr1', no_delete=True), self.firewall_rule(name='fwr2', no_delete=True), self.firewall_rule(name='fwr3', no_delete=True), self.firewall_rule(name='fwr4', no_delete=True)) as fr: fw_rule_ids = [fr[2]['firewall_rule']['id'], fr[3]['firewall_rule']['id']] data = {'firewall_policy': {'firewall_rules': fw_rule_ids}} req = self.new_update_request('firewall_policies', data, fwp['firewall_policy']['id']) req.get_response(self.ext_api) # shuffle the rules, add more rules fw_rule_ids = [fr[1]['firewall_rule']['id'], fr[3]['firewall_rule']['id'], fr[2]['firewall_rule']['id'], fr[0]['firewall_rule']['id']] attrs['firewall_rules'] = fw_rule_ids data = {'firewall_policy': {'firewall_rules': fw_rule_ids}} req = self.new_update_request('firewall_policies', data, fwp['firewall_policy']['id']) res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api)) rules = [] for rule_id in fw_rule_ids: req = self.new_show_request('firewall_rules', rule_id, fmt=self.fmt) res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api)) rules.append(res['firewall_rule']) self.assertEqual(rules[0]['position'], 1) self.assertEqual(rules[0]['id'], fr[1]['firewall_rule']['id']) self.assertEqual(rules[1]['position'], 2) self.assertEqual(rules[1]['id'], fr[3]['firewall_rule']['id']) self.assertEqual(rules[2]['position'], 3) self.assertEqual(rules[2]['id'], fr[2]['firewall_rule']['id']) self.assertEqual(rules[3]['position'], 4) self.assertEqual(rules[3]['id'], fr[0]['firewall_rule']['id'])
deleted_lines: def setUp(self, core_plugin=None, fw_plugin=None, ext_mgr=None): ext_mgr=ext_mgr, if not ext_mgr: self.plugin = importutils.import_object(fw_plugin) ext_mgr = api_ext.PluginAwareExtensionManager( extensions_path, {constants.FIREWALL: self.plugin} ) app = config.load_paste_app('extensions_test_app') self.ext_api = api_ext.ExtensionMiddleware(app, ext_mgr=ext_mgr)

subject: Fixed incorrect timeout tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 14:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/utils.py', 'tox.ini', 'tests/benchmark/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/5bd99c88da1b3c8f5849673fed7bce5b7afa1cd5', 'message': 'Fixed incorrect timeout tests

In this tests string "Timeout" was searched in wrong place.

Also test functions was renamed, and now we run only tests
we need, instead of all tests (see argument -k for pytest).

Also fixed some typos in docstrings and reduced sleep values.

Blueprint test-engine-utils

Change-Id: Ib89f6071fc5d3091ad0c0134a6009f366796cfa3
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed incorrect timeout tests

In this tests string "Timeout" was searched in wrong place.

Also test functions was renamed, and now we run only tests
we need, instead of all tests (see argument -k for pytest).

Also fixed some typos in docstrings and reduced sleep values.

Blueprint test-engine-utils

Change-Id: Ib89f6071fc5d3091ad0c0134a6009f366796cfa3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/83/47383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_dummy_1(): time.sleep(1.1) test = ['./tests/benchmark/test_utils.py', '-k', 'test_dummy_1'] 'test1': ['./tests/benchmark/test_utils.py', '-k', 'test_dummy_1'], 'test_dummy_timeout', '--timeout', '1'] results = tester.run(test, times=2, concurrent=2) for result in results.values(): self.assertTrue('Timeout' in result['msg']) self.assertTrue(result['status'] != 0) def test_tester_no_timeout(self): tester = utils.Tester(self.cloud_config_path) test = ['./tests/benchmark/test_utils.py', '-k', results = tester.run(test, times=2, concurrent=2) for result in results.values(): self.assertTrue('Timeout' not in result['msg']) self.assertTrue(result['status'] == 0)
deleted_lines: def test_dummy(): time.sleep(5) test = ['./tests/benchmark/test_utils.py', '-k', 'test_dummy'] 'test1': ['./tests/benchmark/test_utils.py', '-k', 'test_dummy'], results = tester.run(test, times=10, concurrent=2) self.assertFalse('Timeout' in results.values()[0]['msg'][-2])

commit_message:
Fixes an get_volume_stats reporting issue

This patch fixes a bug introduced in the last get_volume_stats
patch that caused the method to fail.  I Also added another set
of unit tests to catch any future issues related to get_volume_stats.

Fixes Bug: #1178418

Change-Id: I0dd2e0113ff822d3e717ab3d6da6b9d1b914a995

commit_message:
Document instance resource properties

Adds descriptions to the properties of:
* AWS::EC2::Instance

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/69/47369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Rackspace, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. class Request(object): """Captures a transport layer request. The idea is to be declarative i.e. specify *what* is desired. It's up to the respective transport to turn this into an appropriate request.""" def __init__(self, endpoint='', operation='', params=None): self.endpoint = endpoint self.operation = operation self.params = params or {}

commit_message:
Modify job_configs fields to hold configs, args, and params

Job objects and JobExecution objects need the ability to specify
configs, args, and params for job execution.  This change modifies
the 'job_configs' field to be a dictionary of dictionaries instead of
just a list of config values, like so

job_configs = {"configs": {...}, "args": {...}, "params": {...}}

Change-Id: I5c7a7d1f39f512f0fa52cc6d7a307d771bf8c345

commit_message:
Fix volume snapshot creation

The referenced template was wrong, and the quota usages information
had not been switched to using limits.

Thanks to Nuno Santos and Rohan Kanade for the initial versions of
this patch.

Change-Id: I97f578b84cd1cd4babab2580c60f0132026e3c93
Closes-Bug: #1194506

added_lines: scale_cluster(cluster, instances) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Scale an existing Cluster with additional instances. Instances argument is a list of ready-to-configure instances. Plugin should do all configuration operations in this method and start all services on those instances. *Returns*: None decommission_nodes(cluster, instances) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Scale cluster down by removing a list of instances. Plugin should stop services on a provided list of instances. Plugin also may want to update some configurations on other instances, so this method is the right place to do that.

commit_message:
Change create_image signature

At this moment we should specify format of image and container.

In IceHouse we will remove this params, after merging in Glance

commit_message:
Rename vmprovider to serverprovider module

As in future we are going to provide not only VMs but also
baremetal nodes, so it will be better to use more common name
like serverprovider then vmprovider.

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in Savanna subprocessing

Some exceptions could not be serialized by pickle in python 2 because
of the following bug: http://bugs.python.org/issue1692335

Hence current exception handling logic is Savanna subprocessing is
broken: If an exception occurs in child process, it is pickled and
passed to the main process. Then it is unpickled and thrown in the
main process.

The fix changes the behaviour in the following way:
 * Exception message is passed instead of the exception object
 * In the main process SubprocessException is thrown with the message
   passed from the child.

Change-Id: Ib8fac65d2df93cbb585bef02df7576aa6d0a81c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/25/47225/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
refactor db2 get_meter_statistics method to support mongodb and db2

db2 driver for get_meter_statistics method did not work against mongodb
which caused many test cases being skipped. This patch set will fix
that problem also made sure that all statistics functions are supported
by db2 driver against db2 and mongodb database

fixes: bug #1226079

Change-Id: I502aebbab51c51970ddb68641dab89944ce810d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/75/46175/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from __future__ import divisionimport datetimeimport sysfrom ceilometer.openstack.common import timeutils if (groupby and set(groupby) - set(['user_id', 'project_id', 'resource_id', 'source'])): raise NotImplementedError("Unable to group by these fields") if sample_filter.start: period_start = sample_filter.start else: period_start = self.db.meter.find( limit=1, sort=[('timestamp', pymongo.ASCENDING)])[0]['timestamp'] if groupby: sort_keys = ['counter_name'] + groupby + ['timestamp'] else: sort_keys = ['counter_name', 'timestamp'] sort_instructions = self._build_sort_instructions(sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dir='asc') meters = self.db.meter.find(q, sort=sort_instructions) def _group_key(meter): # the method to define a key for groupby call key = {} for y in sort_keys: if y == 'timestamp' and period: key[y] = (timeutils.delta_seconds(period_start, meter[y]) // period) elif y != 'timestamp': key[y] = meter[y] return key def _periods_to_offset(periods): return ((periods * period) // (24 * 3600), (periods * period) % (24 * 3600)) for key, grouped_meters in itertools.groupby(meters, key=_group_key): stat = models.Statistics(None, sys.maxint, -sys.maxint, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, None) for meter in grouped_meters: stat.unit = meter.get('counter_unit', '') m_volume = meter.get('counter_volume') if stat.min > m_volume: stat.min = m_volume if stat.max < m_volume: stat.max = m_volume stat.sum += m_volume stat.count += 1 if stat.duration_start == 0: stat.duration_start = meter['timestamp'] stat.duration_end = meter['timestamp'] if groupby and not stat.groupby: stat.groupby = {} for group_key in groupby: stat.groupby[group_key] = meter[group_key] stat.duration = timeutils.delta_seconds(stat.duration_start, stat.duration_end) stat.avg = stat.sum / stat.count if period: stat.period = period periods = key.get('timestamp') days, seconds = _periods_to_offset(periods) stat.period_start = (period_start + datetime.timedelta(days=days, seconds=seconds)) days, seconds = _periods_to_offset(periods + 1) stat.period_end = (period_start + datetime.timedelta(days=days, seconds=seconds)) else: stat.period_start = stat.duration_start stat.period_end = stat.duration_end yield stat
deleted_lines: if self._using_mongodb: raise NotImplementedError("Statistics not implemented.") if groupby: raise NotImplementedError("Group by not implemented.") raise NotImplementedError('Statistics for period not implemented.') results = self.db.meter.aggregate([ {'$match': q}, {'$group': self.GROUP}, {'$project': self.PROJECT}, ]) # Since there is no period grouping, there should be only one set in # the results rslt = results['result'][0] duration = rslt['duration_end'] - rslt['duration_start'] if hasattr(duration, 'total_seconds'): rslt['duration'] = duration.total_seconds() else: rslt['duration'] = duration.days * 3600 + duration.seconds rslt['period_start'] = rslt['duration_start'] rslt['period_end'] = rslt['duration_end'] # Period is not supported, set it to zero rslt['period'] = 0 rslt['groupby'] = None return [models.Statistics(**(rslt))]

commit_message:
make get_flavor_id to work if input is flavor id

Current implementation of get_flavor_id throws exception if input
value is a flavor id. This method is used in couple of resources
where input flavor could be flavor id. This change is to avoid
throwing exception if the input is flavor id.

Fixes bug #1227255

Change-Id: I11054d5f3a34a7e2afea140f8f37a21cb8eba419

commit_message:
WSME 0.5b5 breaking unit tests

- fix tests to accept new (accurate) response codes
- wsme doesn't like us sending gettextutils.Message values. pass in
a regular string

Change-Id: Ie9e05edfd542ba1fe8c6fdbeed2daab12cf30caf
Fixes:Bug #1227264

Add list containers call to swift client

This patch add the list containers call to swift client, this
can be useful for tests in other projects like Ceilometer.

commit_message:
GraphFlow pattern and single threaded graph action

GraphFlow resolves dependencies automatically and orders nested flows and tasks.
Provides and requires methods were added to actions to gather information about dependencies.
Actions compilation was added to build an execution graph before running the flow.
Unit rests for GraphFlow.

Change-Id: I1b7126867462eacecc8b4b17d7ab6e65123a6fcd

added_lines: from taskflow import flow class Flow(flow.Flow): """Graph flow pattern Nested flows will be executed according to their dependencies that will be resolved using data tasks provide and require. Note: Cyclic dependencies are not allowed. All requirements should be satisfied. def __init__(self, name, uuid=None): super(Flow, self).__init__(name, uuid) def __iter__(self): for child in self._children: yield child
deleted_lines: import logging from networkx.algorithms import dag from networkx.classes import digraph from networkx import exception as g_exc from taskflow import decorators from taskflow import exceptions as exc from taskflow.patterns import linear_flow from taskflow.utils import graph_utils from taskflow.utils import misc LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class Flow(linear_flow.Flow): """A extension of the linear flow which will run the associated tasks in a linear topological ordering (and reverse using the same linear topological order). def __init__(self, name, parents=None, uuid=None): super(Flow, self).__init__(name, parents, uuid) self._graph = digraph.DiGraph() @decorators.locked def add(self, task, infer=True): # Only insert the node to start, connect all the edges # together later after all nodes have been added since if we try # to infer the edges at this stage we likely will fail finding # dependencies from nodes that don't exist. r = misc.AOTRunner(task) self._graph.add_node(r, uuid=r.uuid, infer=infer) self._reset_internals() return r.uuid def _find_uuid(self, uuid): runner = None for r in self._graph.nodes_iter(): if r.uuid == uuid: runner = r break return runner def __len__(self): return len(self._graph) @decorators.locked def add_dependency(self, provider_uuid, requirer_uuid): """Connects provider to requirer where provider will now be required to run before requirer does. """ if provider_uuid == requirer_uuid: raise ValueError("Unable to link %s to itself" % provider_uuid) provider = self._find_uuid(provider_uuid) if not provider: raise ValueError("No provider found with uuid %s" % provider_uuid) requirer = self._find_uuid(requirer_uuid) if not requirer: raise ValueError("No requirer found with uuid %s" % requirer_uuid) self._add_dependency(provider, requirer, reason='manual') self._reset_internals() def _add_dependency(self, provider, requirer, reason): self._graph.add_edge(provider, requirer, reason=reason) def __str__(self): lines = ["GraphFlow: %s" % (self.name)] lines.append("%s" % (self.uuid)) lines.append("%s" % (self._graph.number_of_nodes())) lines.append("%s" % (self._graph.number_of_edges())) lines.append("%s" % (len(self.parents))) lines.append("%s" % (self.state)) return "; ".join(lines) def _reset_internals(self): super(Flow, self)._reset_internals() self._runners = [] @decorators.locked def remove(self, uuid): runner = self._find_uuid(uuid) if not runner: raise ValueError("No uuid %s found" % (uuid)) else: self._graph.remove_node(runner) self._reset_internals() def _ordering(self): try: return iter(self._connect()) except g_exc.NetworkXUnfeasible: raise exc.InvalidStateException("Unable to correctly determine " "the path through the provided " "flow which will satisfy the " "tasks needed inputs and outputs.") def _connect(self): """Connects the nodes & edges of the graph together by examining who the requirements of each node and finding another node that will create said dependency. """ if len(self._graph) == 0: return [] if self._connected: return self._runners # Clear out all automatically added edges since we want to do a fresh # connections. Leave the manually connected ones intact so that users # still retain the dependencies they established themselves. def discard_edge_func(u, v, e_data): if e_data and e_data.get('reason') != 'manual': return True return False # Link providers to requirers. graph_utils.connect(self._graph, discard_func=discard_edge_func) # Now figure out the order so that we can give the runners there # optional item providers as well as figure out the topological run # order. run_order = dag.topological_sort(self._graph) run_stack = [] for r in run_order: r.runs_before = list(reversed(run_stack)) run_stack.append(r) self._runners = run_order self._connected = True return run_order

commit_message:
Graph flow, sequential graph action

Change-Id: I07cc820aa2f37d0f9599f34efab07b28cf47ca48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/95/46295/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from taskflow import flow class Flow(flow.Flow): """Graph flow pattern Nested flows will be executed according to their dependencies that will be resolved using data tasks provide and require. Note: Cyclic dependencies are not allowed. All requirements should be satisfied. def __init__(self, name, uuid=None): super(Flow, self).__init__(name, uuid) def add(self, *items): """Adds a given task/tasks/flow/flows to this flow.""" requirements = {} provided = {} for node in self._graph.nodes_iter(): requirements.update(zip(node.requires, node)) provided.update(zip(node.provides, node)) for item in items: self._graph.add_node(item) for value in item.requires: if value in provided: self._graph.add_edge(provided[value], item) for value in item.provides: if value in requirements: self._graph.add_edge(item, requirements[value]) # Ensure that there is a valid topological ordering. if not dag.is_directed_acyclic_graph(self._graph): raise exc.DependencyFailure("No path through the items in the" " graph produces an ordering that" " will allow for correct dependency" " resolution") return self return len(self._children) def __iter__(self): for child in self._children: yield child @property def provides(self): provides = set() for subflow in self._graph.nodes_iter(): provides.update(subflow.provides) return provides @property def requires(self): requires = set() for subflow in self._graph.nodes_iter(): requires.update(subflow.requires) return requires - self.provides

""" if provider_uuid == requirer_uuid: raise ValueError("Unable to link %s to itself" % provider_uuid) provider = self._find_uuid(provider_uuid) if not provider: raise ValueError("No provider found with uuid %s" % provider_uuid) requirer = self._find_uuid(requirer_uuid) if not requirer: raise ValueError("No requirer found with uuid %s" % requirer_uuid) self._add_dependency(provider, requirer, reason='manual') self._reset_internals() def _add_dependency(self, provider, requirer, reason): self._graph.add_edge(provider, requirer, reason=reason) def __str__(self): lines = ["GraphFlow: %s" % (self.name)] lines.append("%s" % (self.uuid)) lines.append("%s" % (self._graph.number_of_nodes())) lines.append("%s" % (self._graph.number_of_edges())) lines.append("%s" % (len(self.parents))) lines.append("%s" % (self.state)) return "; ".join(lines) def _reset_internals(self): super(Flow, self)._reset_internals() self._runners = [] @decorators.locked def remove(self, uuid): runner = self._find_uuid(uuid) if not runner: raise ValueError("No uuid %s found" % (uuid)) else: self._graph.remove_node(runner) self._reset_internals() def _ordering(self): try: return iter(self._connect()) except g_exc.NetworkXUnfeasible: raise exc.InvalidStateException("Unable to correctly determine " "the path through the provided " "flow which will satisfy the " "tasks needed inputs and outputs.") def _connect(self): """Connects the nodes & edges of the graph together by examining who the requirements of each node and finding another node that will create said dependency. """ if len(self._graph) == 0: return [] if self._connected: return self._runners # Clear out all automatically added edges since we want to do a fresh # connections. Leave the manually connected ones intact so that users # still retain the dependencies they established themselves. def discard_edge_func(u, v, e_data): if e_data and e_data.get('reason') != 'manual': return True return False # Link providers to requirers. graph_utils.connect(self._graph, discard_func=discard_edge_func) # Now figure out the order so that we can give the runners there # optional item providers as well as figure out the topological run # order. run_order = dag.topological_sort(self._graph) run_stack = [] for r in run_order: r.runs_before = list(reversed(run_stack)) run_stack.append(r) self._runners = run_order self._connected = True return run_order

commit_message:
Add ceilometer::agent::auth.

Adds a new agent::auth manifest to hold common auth
parameters used by the Ceilometer compute and central agents.

This fixes a deployment issue where you would get duplicate
auth parameter errors when trying to configure the compute
and central agent on the same machine.

Fixes Bug #1220810.

Change-Id: I167c6c570bdebb4be2ef99cd0b9cf81f37856d9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/83/45083/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The ceilometer::agent::auth class helps configure common # auth settings for the agents. # # == Parameters # [*auth_url*] # the keystone public endpoint # Optional. Defaults to 'http://localhost:5000/v2.0' # # [*auth_region*] # the keystone region of this node # Optional. Defaults to 'RegionOne' # # [*auth_user*] # the keystone user for ceilometer services # Optional. Defaults to 'ceilometer' # # [*auth_password*] # the keystone password for ceilometer services # Optional. Defaults to 'password' # # [*auth_tenant_name*] # the keystone tenant name for ceilometer services # Optional. Defaults to 'services' # # [*auth_tenant_id*] # the keystone tenant id for ceilometer services. # Optional. Defaults to empty. # # [*auth_cacert*] # Certificate chain for SSL validation. Optional; Defaults to 'None' # class ceilometer::agent::auth ( $auth_url = 'http://localhost:5000/v2.0', $auth_region = 'RegionOne', $auth_user = 'ceilometer', $auth_password = 'password', $auth_tenant_name = 'services', $auth_tenant_id = '', $auth_cacert = undef, ) inherits ceilometer { if ! $auth_cacert { ceilometer_config { 'DEFAULT/os_cacert': ensure => absent } } else { ceilometer_config { 'DEFAULT/os_cacert': value => $auth_cacert } } ceilometer_config { 'DEFAULT/os_auth_url' : value => $auth_url; 'DEFAULT/os_auth_region' : value => $auth_region; 'DEFAULT/os_username' : value => $auth_user; 'DEFAULT/os_password' : value => $auth_password; 'DEFAULT/os_tenant_name' : value => $auth_tenant_name; } if ($auth_tenant_id != '') { ceilometer_config { 'DEFAULT/os_tenant_id' : value => $auth_tenant_id; } } }

commit_message:
Implement Power State Change

implement power state change and have some change in drivers fake to
change the power_state of a node.

Change-Id: I7ae896f2e37111eafe7b4ac5a052db4be63411d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/37/45537/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: node_id = node_obj.get('uuid') LOG.debug("RPC start power state change called for node %s." % node_id) with task_manager.acquire(node_id, shared=False) as task: task.driver.power.validate(node_obj) state = task.driver.power.get_power_state(task, node_obj) if state != new_state: task.driver.power.set_power_state(node_obj, new_state) return new_state

self.request = unit_utils.get_fake_request() self.task_id = UUID1 self.fake_task = unit_utils.FakeTask(self.request, self.task_id) self.fake_task_repo = FakeTaskRepo() self.fake_image_repo = test_unpack_task_input_missing_import_format(self): fake_input_json = '{"input_from": "blah", "image_properties": {}}' self.fake_task.input = fake_input_json self.assertRaises(exception.Invalid, self.import_executor.unpack_task_input, self.fake_task) def test_create_image(self): fake_image = { "name": "test_name", "tags": ['tag1', 'tag2'], "foo": "bar" } with mock.patch.object(self.fake_image_factory, 'new_image') as \ mock_new_image: mock_new_image.return_value = {} with mock.patch.object(self.fake_image_repo, 'add') as mock_add: self.import_executor.create_image(fake_image) mock_new_image.assert_called_once_with(extra_properties={'foo': 'bar'}, tags=['tag1', 'tag2'], name='test_name') mock_add.assert_called_once_with({}) def test_execute(self): with mock.patch.object(self.import_executor, 'unpack_task_input') as \ unpack_mock: self.import_executor.execute(self.fake_task) unpack_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.fake_task) self.assertEqual(self.fake_task.message, None) def test_execute_bad_input(self): with mock.patch.object(self.import_executor, 'unpack_task_input') as \ unpack_mock: with mock.patch.object(self.fake_task_repo, 'save') as mock_save: unpack_mock.side_effect = exception.Invalid() self.import_executor.execute(self.fake_task) unpack_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.fake_task) mock_save.assert_called_once_with(self.fake_task) self.assertNotEqual(self.fake_task.message, None)

commit_message:
Fix deprecated params user_id, role_id, tenant_id

Update keystone cli by changing parameter options (user_id, role_id and tenant_id)
to use '-' rather than '_' in the method user_role_add and consequently the method
user_role_remove without maintain backward compatibility because these are deprecated.

python-keystoneclient - Bug #1150434
Change-Id: Ia6c78dd88213c279e07ef7279f69f93b984ac779

commit_message:
Allow more granular logging for dogpile.cache backend

This adds a configuration option to toggle the debug level
on the dogpile logging level.  If disabled, the dogpile logger is
set to use logging.INFO regardless of the rest of the loggers.  This
should reduce the volume of logging in keystone when debug messages
from the dogpile caching library is not needed.

Change-Id: I4f9f9b62f7d23e4c3c60f2af72631d809cf50bec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/78/46178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging from dogpile.core import dogpile if not CONF.cache.debug_cache_library: # Reduce log spam when debugging dogpile.cache is not needed dogpile.log.setLevel(logging.INFO)

catch 404 exception thrown by neutron security_group api

replace the exception with the one nova currently raises for
nova-network which ends up as a 400 on the client side

Fixes bug 1223695

commit_message:
Add back a explicit barbican-worker.py install line.

If this line is not included in the spec file, then a
'Requires: /var/lib/jenkins/.pyenv/shims/python' line shows up in the
RPM builder output, and then the package doesn't install correctly.
This commit is to add this line back into the spec file.

Change-Id: I5e7cf15525c5681bef3034a06339982b373578d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/08/47308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add check for equality operator use for singleton comparsion

PEP8 states that,
    "Comparisons to singletons like None should always be done with
     is or is not, never the equality operators"

Let's not manually check this ever again.

Change-Id: Ifcac4ee4b531accddbe7efa81c1e4e47a799f7ab

commit_message:
Edits for nova.conf.sample

- replace "quotaing" with "quota checking"
- add space so shouldalways becomes "should always"

Modifies docstrings that we use to generate docs for config option
descriptions.

Change-Id: Ieca85ee997b9f85e9748387ee031714ad1b73f6b
