subject: Adding new test execution layer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-16 11:17:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/fe37c239e507396950b10779f0d12e87c68c10ae', 'message': 'Adding new test execution layer.

Now Tester object spawns Printer and WorkerPool.
On request Tester pushes task and repeats number to WorkerPool which can execute tasks
in sequential or concurrect way.
Sequential - WorkerPool pushes one task to each Worker and waits while any Worker will stop
before assigning to first available.
Concurrect - Assigns tasks on workers in round-robin fashion, on Worker side each task
runs in GreenTread which make tests running more concurrent.
After any test execution result is pushed to Printer which will simply print in to stdout.
Any other behaviour should be defined in the react method

Implements: Utilities for test engine
Change-Id: I03bf8ad087bbf1f34c46289d21c309437c72844f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-17 10:04:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/8a74e95e654e47ba9985556020a43caf3a8f5a42', 'message': 'Adding new test execution layer.

Executing tests in multiprocess.Pool.map with blocking untill execution is done.

commit_message:
Adding new test execution layer

Use mulitprocessing.Pool instead of self implementation.

Add timeout to each test. If timeout for single test is not defined
tester will define gloabal timeout = 3600 sec / Number of time test
have to be run.

Implements blueprint test-engine-utils
Change-Id: I03bf8ad087bbf1f34c46289d21c309437c72844f

project installation.

subject: Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-17 05:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/snapshots.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/622f10e87fda5dc439d43543216d953920079282', 'message': 'Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug #1226398

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug #1226398

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/46877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'display_name', # NOTE(thingee): v2 API allows name instead of display_name if 'name' in snapshot: snapshot['display_name'] = snapshot['name'] del snapshot['name']
deleted_lines: # NOTE(thingee): v2 API allows name instead of display_name if 'name' in update_dict: update_dict['display_name'] = update_dict['name'] del update_dict['name']

added_lines: @attr(type='gate') def test_show_pool(self): # Verifies the details of a pool resp, body = self.client.show_pool(self.pool['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) pool = body['pool'] self.assertEqual(self.pool['id'], pool['id']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['name'], pool['name']) @attr(type='gate') def test_list_pools(self): # Verify the pool exists in the list of all pools resp, body = self.client.list_pools() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) pools = body['pools'] found = None for n in pools: if (n['id'] == self.pool['id']): found = n['id'] msg = "Pools list doesn't contain created pool" self.assertIsNotNone(found, msg)

commit_message:
Prevent update_port ip_address from matching address_pair

Previously one could update a port to match one of the address_pairs.
This patch prevents that.

Fixes bug: 1223646

Change-Id: Ic8cecfdb83b3fd9d2691bb41e0427cf578577fc8

commit_message:
Use common create_server method for advanced_ops

This patch changes "create server" implementation from each
implementation to the common method for code clean-up.

Change-Id: I04daf642ffdf5df6c7e5822f5f3c2281b0958a03

commit_message:
Fixing two comments regarding bind_port in ml2

Fixes two comment lines regarding when bind_port
is called. The correct comment should indicate that
bind_port is called prior to "create_port_precommit or
update_port_precommit" rather than
"create_network_precommit or update_network_precommit".

Change-Id: I5c0cb49efb43b15fdc5a7f88569e19fcf8d72819

commit_message:
assertEquals is deprecated, use assertEqual

assertEquals is deprecated in Python 2.7 , need drop it
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Change-Id: I05061251efe1ea840dd9741d254babcf0f565068

commit_message:
Fixes incomplete translation support of "Defaults" table

Inside of administration section, some rows of default quotas table
(e.g. Volumes, Metadata Items, Instances, etc.) were coded using its
name instead of a locale value for its translation.

Change-Id: Iccd163f9a9f35358bf9213491301b070368aff04
Closes-Bug: #1224824

commit_message:
(WIP)Allow to handle objects in different high-level directory

Replaced static DATADIR with dynamic headers thus proxy-server
could read/write different locations on disk.

This was for EC feature.

Change-Id: Ic35921c588745f53fe55432a0ffdbccbb6b23e8f

commit_message:
Rationalize list_user_projects and get_projects_for_user

These two functions have slightly different implementations and yet neither
takes into account group or inherited roles.  Rationalize these into a single
list_projects_for_user() that gets the correct list of project refs, allowing
for group and inherited roles.  The public API name, as referenced in the
policy file, remains as 'list_user_projects' to avoid a policy file change
at this late stage.

The most common use cases of the above is via the v2 API, when we need
to ensure only projects from the default domain are included.  Given that
this means we must inspect each project ref anyway, having a call that
returns a list of IDs will not be any more efficient than returning the
project refs and letting the caller extract the IDs.

Fixes bug #1201487

Change-Id: I614140639c71dae4dfe501d27eda65e41a78694d

commit_message:
Restore icons on buttons

With the switch to lesscpy, the icons were not being displayed on
buttons anymore. Avoiding nested Mixin definitions appears to resolve
the issue.

Change-Id: I09699fb37f55b989893905f3b8978a17e317f598
Closes-Bug: #1226580

commit_message:
Regenerate POT (English PO) files

If POT files contains translated messages, Transifex seems to use
msgstr rather than msgid as index, and this leads to incorrect
source language strings in Transifex [1].
POT files should not have any strings in msgstr to avoid this problem.

This commit regenerates POT files from scratch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2013-September/000103.html

Closes-Bug: #1226428
Change-Id: I9aa11323edbfd98b95bbc2c26be337cc77df5e87

commit_message:
Fix use of bare list/dict types in instance_group object

The instance_group object was merged before we had helpers for
dict and list objects of strings. This makes that object use those
for schema safety.

Change-Id: I1f68e43a83f140f7b29b17c0961b267e64e48390
Closes-bug: 1221383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/45304/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Version 1.2: Use list/dict helpers for policies, metadetails, members VERSION = '1.2' 'policies': obj_utils.list_of_strings_or_none, 'metadetails': obj_utils.dict_of_strings_or_none, 'members': obj_utils.list_of_strings_or_none,

commit_message:
Increase volume created checking retries to 60

In some cases 30 retries with 1 sec interval is not enough for
volume to be created.
Increased max tries to 60

Fixes bug 1213953

Change-Id: I6bcd395a4bac940387384cc85691d7219cf90e63

commit_message:
Update README.rst to use testr instead of nose

This commit just changes the references to nose in the project README
to testr. It also adds a sentence about using run_tests.sh and tox.

Change-Id: I7512b7f954c1c83186b1f428e9371261cf50f41b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/46990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tempest is not tied to any single test runner, but testr is the most commonlythe set of Tempest tests by using ``testr`` :: $> testr run --parallel tempest $> testr run --parallel tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_nonexistent_server Alternatively, you can use the run_tests.sh script which will create a venv and run the tests or use tox to do the same.
deleted_lines: Tempest is not tied to any single test runner, but Nose been the most commonlythe set of Tempest tests by using ``nosetests`` :: $> nosetests tempest $> nosetests -sv tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.py: ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_nonexistent_server

commit_message:
Add missing dependency on neutron-server

When installing neutron with the linuxbridge plugin,
a dependency is missing on the package 'neutron-server' which provides
the file /etc/default/neutron-server.

Add a dependency on neutron-server.

Closes-bug: #1224740
Change-Id: I0a9d7195618e21426970e814817b7f87dcba8d8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/95/46395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require => [ Package['neutron-plugin-linuxbridge'], Package['neutron-server'], ],

commit_message:
Update glance::backend::rbd options

This patch is aim to add rbd options in glance-api.conf
and also update related spec test.

Fixes bug #1221074

Change-Id: Ifcbaf15ab4a7aedb074abac42941181e53d538c4

Default:'/etc/ceph/ceph.conf' # # $rbd_store_chunk_size - Optional. Default:'8' $rbd_store_ceph_conf = '/etc/ceph/ceph.conf', $rbd_store_user = 'glance', $rbd_store_pool = 'images', $rbd_store_chunk_size = '8', 'DEFAULT/default_store': value => 'rbd'; 'DEFAULT/rbd_store_ceph_conf': value => $rbd_store_ceph_conf; 'DEFAULT/rbd_store_user': value => $rbd_store_user; 'DEFAULT/rbd_store_pool': value => $rbd_store_pool; 'DEFAULT/rbd_store_chunk_size': value => $rbd_store_chunk_size;

commit_message:
Add ability to configure control_exchange

Add control_exchange parameter with default to 'openstack'.

The control_exchange configuration defaults to 'openstack' in Cinder.

Fixes: bug #1220272
Change-Id: Ic15e471a745568e5183ad9eedba92c213026309e
(cherry picked from commit 15e32b1e4ab513fbe980e84d6585be42385c0ca7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/36/47036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should contain_cinder_config('DEFAULT/control_exchange').with( :value => 'openstack' )

commit_message:
BigSwitch plugin: passes context to all update_network calls

There were a few calls to update the network on the backend
that were not having the context passed to them so they were
incorrectly using the admin context. This patch corrects that
by passing the context to all network update calls. It also
disallows calls to _send_update_network that don't provide
the context because there is not a use case for that condition.

Closes-Bug: #1226803
Change-Id: I7f0cbb797df9f565d0a00a7c67278cd96301f244

commit_message:
Verify provides and requires

When flow is being constructed we ensure that it is actually valid by
checking its invariants:
- for linear flow, no item should depend on items that are executed
  after it;
- for unordered flow, items should be independent.

We also add check that all necessary provides were injected to storage
before actually running flow.

Implements: blueprint flow-verification
Change-Id: I499898f543505b7dd6f82716ae8f4011cb08f601

commit_message:
Version conflict for 'requests' resolved

Current version of python-cinderclient in pypi requires 'requests<1.2.3',
while current (and installed) version of requests is 1.2.3.
Project's requirements updated to specify version of requests to match
python-cinderclient requirements.

Fixes bug #1221139

Change-Id: I6793fad9ccdbf715962c09b2b1943bed8a9cb1d1

commit_message:
Handle cross instance depends on

Instrument wait condition and wait condition handle to store signals,
using cfn-signal to send signals, using cfn-get-metadata to retrieve
signals, generate script files to invoke.

Change-Id: Ice74daab466cf398b69db7ce1eb45409e788e10c
Implements: blueprint hot-software-config-deps

"]]}} def properties(self, hosted): props = {} names = self.filter(hosted) for name in names: comp = self[name] props.update(comp.properties) return props def configsets(self, hosted): configs = {} names = self.filter(hosted) if len(names) == 0: return configs sets = ['init'] configs['init'] = self.initial for name in names: comp = self[name] configset = comp.configset(name) sets.append(name) configs[name] = configset configs['configSets'] = {'default': sets} return configs def resources(self): res = {} count = len(self) if count == 0: return res timeout = count * 60 * 60 # 1 hour each config res["WaitCondition"] = { "Properties": { "Handle": {"Ref": "Handle"}, "Count": "%s" % count, "Timeout": "%s" % timeout }, "Type": "AWS::CloudFormation::WaitCondition" } res["Handle"] = { "Type": "AWS::CloudFormation::WaitConditionHandle" } res["AccessKey"] = { "Type": "AWS::IAM::AccessKey", "Properties": { "UserName": {"Ref": "User"} } } res["User"] = { "Type": "AWS::IAM::User" } return res

commit_message:
xenapi: extract vm installation

This change makes it easier to use an existing xva for your XenServer
installation by removing the templating, and using only snapshots. Thus
the OpenStack VM could be exported and re-used to speed up tests. Also
various cleanups has been made.

related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie3d4ce69f35d7768016be8dc906808092d8e2df5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/97/36697/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function print_ip() { local xenapi_connection_url xenapi_connection_url="$1" echo $xenapi_connection_url | tr -d -c '1234567890.' } function _print_domid() { local vm_name_label vm_name_label="$1" xe vm-list name-label="$vm_name_label" params=dom-id minimal=true } function _print_vnc_port() { local vm_name_label vm_name_label="$1" xenstore-read \ /local/domain/$(_print_domid "$vm_name_label")/console/vnc-port } function print_display() { local vm_name_label vm_name_label="$1" expr $(_print_vnc_port "$vm_name_label") - 5900 } function log_info() { set +x echo -e "\e[0;32m" cat | sed 's/^/INFO: /' echo -e "\e[0m" set -x } function log_error() { set +x echo -e "\e[0;31m" cat | sed 's/^/ERROR: /' echo -e "\e[0m" set -x } function wait_for_vm_to_halt() { local vm_name_label vm_name_label="$1" local vm_state set +x while true; do vm_state=$(xe_min vm-list name-label="$vm_name_label" power-state=halted) if [ -n "$vm_state" ]; then break else sleep 20 fi done set -x } function set_reboot_on_restart() { local vm_name_label vm_name_label="$1" local vm vm=$(_vm_uuid "$vm_name_label") xe vm-param-set actions-after-reboot=Restart uuid=$vm }

commit_message:
Add boto tests for InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior=terminate

The EC2 API supports two different behaviors when an instance
shuts itself down -- 'stop' and 'terminate'.  This boto test
starts an instance of each and uses ssh to call shutdown inside
the instance, and then checks to see if the instance ends
up in 'stopped' state or if it's gone completely.

Fixes bug #1131395

Change-Id: Ia79083379f8161b77336cf595c90f1dbffbf7409
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/39340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_instance_initiated_shutdown(self): reservation = self.ec2_client.run_instances( image_id=self.images["ami"]["image_id"], kernel_id=self.images["aki"]["image_id"], ramdisk_id=self.images["ari"]["image_id"], instance_type=self.instance_type, key_name=self.keypair_name, instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior='terminate') rcuk_term = self.addResourceCleanUp(self.destroy_reservation, reservation) instance_term = reservation.instances[0] reservation = self.ec2_client.run_instances( image_id=self.images["ami"]["image_id"], kernel_id=self.images["aki"]["image_id"], ramdisk_id=self.images["ari"]["image_id"], instance_type=self.instance_type, key_name=self.keypair_name, instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior='stop') rcuk_stop = self.addResourceCleanUp(self.destroy_reservation, reservation) instance_stop = reservation.instances[0] for instance in (instance_stop, instance_term): if instance.state != "running": self.assertInstanceStateWait(instance, "running") ssh = RemoteClient(instance.private_ip_address, self.os.config.compute.ssh_user, pkey=self.keypair.material) ssh.poweroff() self.assertInstanceStateWait(instance_stop, "stopped") instance_stop.terminate() self.cancelResourceCleanUp(rcuk_stop) self.assertInstanceStateWait(instance_term, "_GONE") self.cancelResourceCleanUp(rcuk_term) @attr(type='smoke')

commit_message:
Refactor ownership check during instance delete

This change refactors the code that chooses the project_id and user_id
when nova compute deletes an instance.  The two checks for instance
ownership are refactored into two new helper functions in the nova
compute utils.  Duplicate code in the nova-compute api and manager
modules is removed.

Change-Id: Ia25c66a79b85890d09fb8f4aadc59b472fc7fbe6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/43638/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_tenant_from_owner(context, instance): """If we do not own the given instance, return the instance's tenant ID. If the current user is an admin and is not the instance's tenant (i.e. we are modifying someone else's instance), return the instance's tenant ID. Otherwise, return the context's tenant ID. :params context: A security context :params instance: An instance of Instance """ if context.is_admin and context.tenant != instance['project_id']: # We are modifying someone else's instance return instance['project_id'] else: return context.tenant def get_user_from_owner(context, instance): """If we do not own the given instance, return the instance's user ID. Otherwise, return the context's user ID. :params context: A security context :params instance: An instance of Instance """ if context.user != instance['user_id']: # We are modifying someone else's instance return instance['user_id'] else: return context.user

commit_message:
Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots

This change modifies the behaviour of the secure delete for thick
LVM snapshots to wipe the underlying COW of the snapshot LV
instead of the snapshot LV itself.

This change is necessary because the snapshot LV does not contain
exactly the same number of writable blocks as the original LV.  The
COW includes header information per COW block that identifies the
device as a COW device as well as the source and destination blocks
for the changed item.  The amount of metadata contained in the COW is
variable based on I/O performed on the snapshot.

This does not change the behavior of secure deletes on thin LVs
or secure deletes on the thick LV snapshot origin.

Closes-Bug: #1191812
Change-Id: I20e02b6c20d5ac539b5b5469e665fc986180f2e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/14/45114/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.path.exists(dev_path): self.clear_volume(volume, is_snapshot) def clear_volume(self, volume, is_snapshot=False): if is_snapshot: # if the volume to be cleared is a snapshot of another volume # we need to clear out the volume using the -cow instead of the # directly volume path. # bug# lp1191812 vol_path = self.local_path(volume) + "-cow" else: vol_path = self.local_path(volume)
deleted_lines: # TODO(jdg): Maybe we could optimize this for snaps by looking at # the cow table and only overwriting what's necessary? # for now we're still skipping on snaps due to hang issue if os.path.exists(dev_path) and not is_snapshot: self.clear_volume(volume) def clear_volume(self, volume): vol_path = self.local_path(volume)

commit_message:
Fix a tiny mistake in api doc

GET /v2/meters/{meter_id} will return a list of samples that
limited to the specific meter.

Change-Id: I753a68b99d9ac253186689c73975e450cf335f3c
Fixes: Bug #1226524

Add test cases for resume_state_on_host_boot

part of blueprint libvirt-driver-tests

Co-authored-by: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

self.mox.ReplayAll() def fake_lookup_by_name(instance_name): return mock def fake_hard_reboot(*args): called['count'] += 1 conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) commit_message:
Remove extra 'console' key for index in extensions consoles v3

Fix bug 1224294

* remove the extra 'console' key
* remove xml template serializer, because default serializer is enough

commit_message:
Fix non-unicode string values on objects

Originally, all of the objects used str() to specify string type
attributes. This prevents the use of unicode values. A previous
patch errantly updated the utility function without bumping all
of the affected objects' versions. This does that, and also
fixes the issue for bare str() attributes.

Change-Id: Iad83589d399309b95c32813a1a660a12e571066b
Closes-bug: 1221346

commit_message:
Document DiskFile API, fix ref impl unit tests

Add sphinx documentation for the DiskFile pluggable backend API. We
also updated references to the other account and container backend
docs.

** We have removed the "upload_size" attribute of the DiskFileWriter,
   changing it to be a return value of the "write()" method instead
   (one step simpler API).

As part of documenting the interface, all of the attributes have had
underscores ("_") appended to define them as internal to the reference
implementation.

Change-Id: I7385e8cf5712f7e0a0d43615b7bac2bd428787d5
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/10/47010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2010-2013 OpenStack, LLC. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ In-Memory Disk File Interface for Swift Object Server""" from __future__ import with_statement import cStringIO import time import hashlib import traceback from contextlib import contextmanager from eventlet import Timeout from swift import gettext_ as _ from swift.common.ondisk import normalize_timestamp from swift.common.exceptions import DiskFileQuarantined, DiskFileNotExist, \ DiskFileCollision, DiskFileDeleted, DiskFileNotOpen from swift.common.swob import multi_range_iterator class InMemoryFileSystem(object): """ This is a very simplistic scheme. There is one dictionary mapping a given object name to a tuple. The first entry in the tuble is the cStringIO buffer representing the file contents, the second entry is the metadata dictionary. """ def __init__(self): self._filesystem = {} def get_object(self, name): val = self._filesystem.get(name) if val is None: data, metadata = None, None else: data, metadata = val return data, metadata def put_object(self, name, data, metadata): self._filesystem[name] = (data, metadata) def del_object(self, name): del self._filesystem[name] def get_diskfile(self, account, container, obj, **kwargs): return DiskFile(self, account, container, obj) class DiskFileWriter(object): """ Encapsulation of the write context for servicing PUT REST API requests. Serves as the context manager object for DiskFile's create() method. """ def __init__(self, fs, name, fp): self._filesystem = fs self._name = name self._fp = fp self.upload_size = 0 def write(self, chunk): """ Write a chunk of data into the temporary file. :param chunk: the chunk of data to write as a string object """ self._fp.write(chunk) self.upload_size += len(chunk) def put(self, metadata): """ Finalize writing the file on disk, and renames it from the temp file to the real location. This should be called after the data has been written to the temp file. :param metadata: dictionary of metadata to be written :param extension: extension to be used when making the file """ metadata['name'] = self._name self._filesystem.put_object(self._name, self._fp, metadata) class DiskFileReader(object): """ Encapsulation of the read context for servicing GET REST API requests. Serves as the context manager object for DiskFile's reader() method. :param disk_file: DiskFile object associated with this reader :param fp: open file object pointer reference :param iter_hook: called when __iter__ returns a chunk :param keep_cache: should resulting reads be kept in the buffer cache """ def __init__(self, name, fp, obj_size, etag, iter_hook=None): self._name = name self._fp = fp self._obj_size = obj_size self._etag = etag self._iter_hook = iter_hook # self._iter_etag = None self._bytes_read = 0 self._started_at_0 = False self._read_to_eof = False self._suppress_file_closing = False # self.was_quarantined = '' def __iter__(self): """Returns an iterator over the data file.""" try: self._bytes_read = 0 self._started_at_0 = False self._read_to_eof = False if self._fp.tell() == 0: self._started_at_0 = True self._iter_etag = hashlib.md5() while True: chunk = self._fp.read() if chunk: if self._iter_etag: self._iter_etag.update(chunk) self._bytes_read += len(chunk) yield chunk if self._iter_hook: self._iter_hook() else: self._read_to_eof = True break finally: if not self._suppress_file_closing: self.close() def app_iter_range(self, start, stop): """Returns an iterator over the data file for range (start, stop)""" if start or start == 0: self._fp.seek(start) if stop is not None: length = stop - start else: length = None try: for chunk in self: if length is not None: length -= len(chunk) if length < 0: # Chop off the extra: yield chunk[:length] break yield chunk finally: if not self._suppress_file_closing: self.close() def app_iter_ranges(self, ranges, content_type, boundary, size): """Returns an iterator over the data file for a set of ranges""" if not ranges: yield '' else: try: self._suppress_file_closing = True for chunk in multi_range_iterator( ranges, content_type, boundary, size, self.app_iter_range): yield chunk finally: self._suppress_file_closing = False try: self.close() except DiskFileQuarantined: pass def _quarantine(self, msg): self.was_quarantined = msg def _handle_close_quarantine(self): """Check if file needs to be quarantined""" if self._bytes_read != self._obj_size: self._quarantine( "Bytes read: %s, does not match metadata: %s" % ( self.bytes_read, self._obj_size)) elif self._iter_etag and \ self._etag != self._iter_etag.hexdigest(): self._quarantine( "ETag %s and file's md5 %s do not match" % ( self._etag, self._iter_etag.hexdigest())) def close(self, verify_file=True): """ Close the file. Will handle quarantining file if necessary. :param verify_file: Defaults to True. If false, will not check file to see if it needs quarantining. """ if self._fp: try: if verify_file and self._started_at_0 and self._read_to_eof: self._handle_close_quarantine() except (Exception, Timeout) as e: pass finally: self._fp = None class DiskFile(object): """ Manage object files in-memory. This duck-types the standard DiskFile class. :param mgr: DiskFileManager :param device_path: path to the target device or drive :param threadpool: thread pool to use for blocking operations :param partition: partition on the device in which the object lives :param account: account name for the object :param container: container name for the object :param obj: object name for the object :param iter_hook: called when __iter__ returns a chunk :param keep_cache: caller's preference for keeping data read in the cache """ def __init__(self, fs, account, container, obj): self._name = '/' + '/'.join((account, container, obj)) self._metadata = None self._fp = None self._filesystem = fs def open(self): """ Open the file and read the metadata. This method must populate the _metadata attribute. :raises DiskFileCollision: on name mis-match with metadata :raises DiskFileDeleted: if it does not exist, or a tombstone is present :raises DiskFileQuarantined: if while reading metadata of the file some data did pass cross checks """ fp, self._metadata = self._filesystem.get_object(self._name) if fp is None: raise DiskFileDeleted() self._fp = self._verify_data_file(fp) self._metadata = self._metadata or {} return self def __enter__(self): if self._metadata is None: raise DiskFileNotOpen() return self def __exit__(self, t, v, tb): if self._fp is not None: self._fp = None def _verify_data_file(self, fp): """ Verify the metadata's name value matches what we think the object is named. :raises DiskFileCollision: if the metadata stored name does not match the referenced name of the file :raises DiskFileNotExist: if the object has expired :raises DiskFileQuarantined: if data inconsistencies were detected between the metadata and the file-system metadata """ try: mname = self._metadata['name'] except KeyError: self._quarantine(self._name, "missing name metadata") else: if mname != self._name: raise DiskFileCollision('Client path does not match path ' 'stored in object metadata') try: x_delete_at = int(self._metadata['X-Delete-At']) except KeyError: pass except ValueError: # Quarantine, the x-delete-at key is present but not an # integer. self._quarantine( self._name, "bad metadata x-delete-at value %s" % ( self._metadata['X-Delete-At'])) else: if x_delete_at <= time.time(): raise DiskFileNotExist('Expired') try: metadata_size = int(self._metadata['Content-Length']) except KeyError: self._quarantine( self._name, "missing content-length in metadata") except ValueError: # Quarantine, the content-length key is present but not an # integer. self._quarantine( self._name, "bad metadata content-length value %s" % ( self._metadata['Content-Length'])) try: fp.seek(0, 2) obj_size = fp.tell() fp.seek(0, 0) except OSError as err: # Quarantine, we can't successfully stat the file. self._quarantine(self._name, "not stat-able: %s" % err) if obj_size != metadata_size: self._quarantine( self._name, "metadata content-length %s does" " not match actual object size %s" % ( metadata_size, obj_size)) return fp def get_metadata(self): """ Provide the metadata for an object as a dictionary. :returns: object's metadata dictionary """ if self._metadata is None: raise DiskFileNotOpen() return self._metadata def read_metadata(self): """ Return the metadata for an object. :returns: metadata dictionary for an object """ with self.open(): return self.get_metadata() def reader(self, iter_hook=None, keep_cache=False): """ Return a swift.common.swob.Response class compatible "app_iter" object. The responsibility of closing the open file is passed to the DiskFileReader object. :param iter_hook: :param keep_cache: """ dr = DiskFileReader(self._name, self._fp, int(self._metadata['Content-Length']), self._metadata['ETag'], iter_hook=iter_hook) # At this point the reader object is now responsible for # the file pointer. self._fp = None return dr @contextmanager def create(self, size=None): """ Context manager to create a file. We create a temporary file first, and then return a DiskFileWriter object to encapsulate the state. :param size: optional initial size of file to explicitly allocate on disk :raises DiskFileNoSpace: if a size is specified and allocation fails """ fp = cStringIO.StringIO() try: yield DiskFileWriter(self._filesystem, self._name, fp) finally: del fp def write_metadata(self, metadata): """ Write a block of metadata to an object. """ cur_fp = self._filesystem.get(self._name) if cur_fp is not None: self._filesystem[self._name] = (cur_fp, metadata) def delete(self, timestamp): """ Perform a delete for the given object in the given container under the given account. This creates a tombstone file with the given timestamp, and removes any older versions of the object file. Any file that has an older timestamp than timestamp will be deleted. :param timestamp: timestamp to compare with each file """ timestamp = normalize_timestamp(timestamp) fp, md = self._filesystem.get_object(self._name) if md['X-Timestamp'] < timestamp: self._filesystem.del_object(self._name)

subject: Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-18 00:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/0620cf6bb5f6dc18a9f42a56b8be00c37016e97a', 'message': 'Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots

This change modifies the behaviour of the secure delete for thick
LVM snapshots to wipe the underlying COW of the snapshot LV
instead of the snapshot LV itself.

This change is necessary because the snapshot LV does not contain
exactly the same number of writable blocks as the original LV.  The
COW includes header information per COW block that identifies the
device as a COW device as well as the source and destination blocks
for the changed item.  The amount of metadata contained in the COW is
variable based on I/O performed on the snapshot.

This does not change the behavior of secure deletes on thin LVs
or secure deletes on the thick LV snapshot origin.

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py
	cinder/tests/test_volume.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py

Closes-Bug: #1191812
Change-Id: I20e02b6c20d5ac539b5b5469e665fc986180f2e9
(cherry picked from commit f702fe7e30e4021895dac8e7ab243e5192f8182d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots

This change modifies the behaviour of the secure delete for thick
LVM snapshots to wipe the underlying COW of the snapshot LV
instead of the snapshot LV itself.

This change is necessary because the snapshot LV does not contain
exactly the same number of writable blocks as the original LV.  The
COW includes header information per COW block that identifies the
device as a COW device as well as the source and destination blocks
for the changed item.  The amount of metadata contained in the COW is
variable based on I/O performed on the snapshot.

This does not change the behavior of secure deletes on thin LVs
or secure deletes on the thick LV snapshot origin.

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py
	cinder/tests/test_volume.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py

Closes-Bug: #1191812
Change-Id: I20e02b6c20d5ac539b5b5469e665fc986180f2e9
(cherry picked from commit f702fe7e30e4021895dac8e7ab243e5192f8182d)

commit_message:
Add extend_volume for Huawei driver

Add extend_volume for Huawei T and Dorado5100 drivers.
We should create a volume with the increased size before
extending the origin volume. we also need to remove the
added volumes and delete them before delete the extended
volume. So we define a global list self.extended_lun_dict
to store the added volumes for each extended volume.

fixes bug 1225901

Change-Id: I761db4e9f8d337d10e64e53c314cd7fe615090a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/01/46701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add extend_volume for Huawei HVS driver

Add extend_volume for Huawei HVS iSCSI and FC drivers.

fixes bug 1225901

Change-Id: Ie109a44a355fe7ce60455af4a77ee5cbcae9b823

added_lines: def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): name = self._encode_name(volume['id']) lun_id = self._get_volume_by_name(name) if lun_id is not None: url = self.url + "/lun/expand" capacity = int(new_size) * units.GiB / 512 data = json.dumps({"TYPE": "11", "ID": lun_id, "CAPACITY": capacity}) result = self.call(url, data, "PUT") self._assert_rest_result(result, 'Extend lun error.') else: LOG.warn(_('Can't find lun in array'))

commit_message:
Move textmode forcer to vm element.

Changing the grub config makes no sense in a build not heading for a vm
and may fail because grub is removed from images not including the vm
element. Forcing textmode for those images would be better done in nova.

Change-Id: I1c5b89e551e62df2463200b1889cb2342498c7dd

commit_message:
Validate OS::Nova::Server block_device_mapping property

Make sure either volume_id or snapshot_id exists but not both. Also this patch
ensures that a bootable volume is specified when image is not given.

Fixes bug #1215267

Change-Id: Ia51f6c7aec9c0b257318992ee58febc392ea3d84

commit_message:
Remove restart of iscsi services.

These services are named differently on Fedora and were failing the
run of os-collect-config.  Removing them altogether because, there's
no good reason for them to be restarted for Ubuntu either.

Change-Id: Ie99fb0c0071f1569651b75d5a9c0cdf53d37c57c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/50/47050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Debug and verbose are overridden by the log_config parameter, since

Change-Id: I003ea1a80efc3e9271015393feb7ef7413412331
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-18 00:19:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/os-apply-config/etc/nova/nova.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/6684bfe3967d5747840f53da67d538a952ec26df', 'message': "Remove debug and verbose config from nova.conf

Verbose is overridden by the log_config parameter, since
this is overridden anyway no reason to keep it around as it can
only lead to confusion.

Debug is used to set the log level, although its overridden by
log_config as well, and is also used to turn on debug mode only checks.
Since we want the default values here to be for production we shouldn't
set debug=True here.

Change-Id: I003ea1a80efc3e9271015393feb7ef7413412331
"}]
commit_message:
Remove debug and verbose config from nova.conf

Verbose is overridden by the log_config parameter, since
this is overridden anyway no reason to keep it around as it can
only lead to confusion.

Debug is used to set the log level, although its overridden by
log_config as well, and is also used to turn on debug mode only checks.
Since we want the default values here to be for production we shouldn't
set debug=True here.

Change-Id: I003ea1a80efc3e9271015393feb7ef7413412331
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/58/47058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't need to init testr in run_tests.sh

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository,
setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1222688
Change-Id: I51e73efe4e9b80bbf0159a5bce0db81fc049b9ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/35/46635/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Translate all substitution elements of a Message object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-11 16:28:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/cd0ede49a2ba93608bd126d49152fe9fa82e3045', 'message': "Translate all substitution elements of a Message object

Some Messages are created with Message objects interpolated within a
Message. E.g.:

    msg = _('Message 1: %(msg_2)s') % {'msg_2': _('Message 2')}

The problem is that we were only translating the base Message but not
the Message substitutions within, thus in those cases Messages were only
being partially translated.

The fix sets the locale property for all Message substitution parameters
upon setting it on the base Message.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-11 16:29:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/c68b473b39cd8ea505aa1f90ba77eff4a70fddd6', 'message': "Translate all substitution elements of a Message object

Some Messages are created with further Message object substitutions.
E.g.:

    msg = _('Message 1: %(msg_2)s') % {'msg_2': _('Message 2')}

The problem is that we were only translating the base Message but not
the Message substitutions within, thus in those cases Messages were only
being partially translated.

The fix sets the locale property for all Message substitution parameters
upon setting it on the base Message.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf

commit_message:
Translate all substitution elements of a Message object

Some Messages are created with further Message object substitutions.
E.g.:

    msg = _('Message 1: %(msg_2)s') % {'msg_2': _('Message 2')}

The problem is that we were only translating the base Message but not
the Message substitutions within, thus in those cases Messages were only
being partially translated.

The fix sets the locale property for all Message substitution parameters
upon setting it on the base Message.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/96/46096/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._locale = None @property def locale(self): return self._locale @locale.setter def locale(self, value): self._locale = value if not self.params: return # This Message object may have been constructed with other Message # objects as substitution parameters, so when setting the locale for # this object we need to set it for those params too. for param_key in self.params: param = self.params[param_key] if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value 'domain', 'params', '_locale']

commit_message:
Include new notification options in sample config

Some new configuration options were added with the change to add
notifications to Keystone, but these new options weren't added
to the sample config file.

This change adds the new options to the sample configuration
file along with the descriptions from
keystone.openstack.common.notifier.api.

Also, if the Keystone server uses the RPC options from
keystone/openstack/common/rpc/__init__.py if using the RPC
notification driver, so these options are also added to the
sample config file.

Having these options in the config file will make it easier for
administrators to update the configuration values.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I85f2450a6fb68d51453adbb5413ad48fe00ca17e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/88/45488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # === Notification Options === # Driver or drivers to handle sending notifications # notification_driver = # Default notification level for outgoing notifications # default_notification_level = INFO # Default publisher_id for outgoing notifications # default_publisher_id =

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2013-09-10 10:15:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/db22ce47e73fdb425fae52ce31a544990b8a8a78', 'message': 'Support advanced NVP LBaaS Service Plugin

VCNS:
        * NVP LBaaS is an advanced Service of NVP depending on NVP
          advanced service router
            - Once an advanced router id created, one corresponding
              vshield edge will be deployed, and then we can configure
              LB service On the vshield edge
        * NVP LBaaS service plugin still uses LBaaS DB service logic,
          while finally calling vShield Edge to support FWaaS service
            - When one object is created, we will attach the object to
              the advanced router with routedserviceinsertion service
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

Implements: blueprint nvp-lbaas-plugin
Change-Id: Iec41f2dc103daddf3bed4d09c147df3865b3dccd

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2013-09-14 09:39:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/10ec920539854f5019fcc9e3410847c6057cb014', 'message': 'Support advanced NVP LBaaS Service

The patch adds NVP advanced LBaaS service support for NVP with
VCNS:
        * NVP LBaaS is an advanced Service of NVP depending on NVP
          advanced service router
            - Once an advanced router id created, one corresponding
              vshield edge will be deployed, and then we can configure
              LB service On the vshield edge
        * NVP LBaaS service plugin still uses LBaaS DB service logic,
          while finally calling vShield Edge to support FWaaS service
            - When creating VIP object, service attaches the object to
              the advanced router with routedserviceinsertion service.
              Then before pushing VIP VCNS call, the server would first
              pushing associated POOL VCNS call and associated Monitor
              VCNS call to vShield Edge. Deleting VIP is opposite
              operation
            - Refering to CUD operation of other objects, service would
              first find the associated VIP object and then find the edge bound to
              the router which vip inserted. Then service would push corresponding
              VCNS call to Vshield Edge
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

Implements: blueprint nvp-lbaas-plugin
Change-Id: Iec41f2dc103daddf3bed4d09c147df3865b3dccd

              first find the associated VIP object and then find the edge bound to
              the router which vip inserted. Then service would push corresponding
              VCNS call to Vshield Edge
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

Implements: blueprint nvp-lbaas-plugin
Change-Id: Iec41f2dc103daddf3bed4d09c147df3865b3dccd

commit_message:
Support advanced NVP LBaaS Service

The patch adds NVP advanced LBaaS service support for NVP with
VCNS:
        * NVP LBaaS is an advanced Service of NVP depending on NVP
          advanced service router
            - Once an advanced router id created, one corresponding
              vshield edge will be deployed, and then we can configure
              LB service On the vshield edge
        * NVP LBaaS service plugin still uses LBaaS DB service logic,
          while finally calling vShield Edge to support FWaaS service
            - When creating VIP object, service attaches the object to
              the advanced router with routedserviceinsertion service.
              Then before pushing VIP VCNS call, the server would first
              pushing associated POOL VCNS call and associated Monitor
              VCNS call to vShield Edge. Deleting VIP is opposite
              operation
            - Refering to CUD operation of other objects, service would
              first find the associated VIP object and then find the edge bound to
              the router which vip inserted. Then service would push corresponding
              VCNS call to Vshield Edge
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

Implements: blueprint nvp-lbaas-plugin
Change-Id: Iec41f2dc103daddf3bed4d09c147df3865b3dccd

# vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Copyright 2013 VMware, Inc # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Kaiwei linb, VMware import logging import time from neutron.common import exceptions as q_exc from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 from neutron.plugins.nicira.dbexts import nicira_models from neutron.plugins.nicira.vmware.vshield.tasks import ( constants as task_const) from neutron.plugins.nicira.vmware.vshield.tasks import tasks from neutron.plugins.nicira.vmware.vshield.vcns.common import ( constants as vcns_const) from neutron.plugins.nicira.vmware.vshield.vcns.common import ( VcnsApiClient) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # status Level ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_ACTIVE = 0 ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_DOWN = 1 ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_PENDING_CREATE = 2 ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_PENDING_DELETE = 3 ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_ERROR = 4 class EdgeApplianceDriver(db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2): ##TODO(linb): validation of all values def _assemble_edge(self, name, datacenter_moid, appliance_size="compact", enable_aesni="true", hypervisor_assist="false", enable_fips="false", remote_access="false"): edge = { 'datacenterMoid': datacenter_moid, 'name': name, 'fqdn': name, 'hypervisorAssist': hypervisor_assist, 'enableAesni': enable_aesni, 'enableFips': enable_fips, 'cliSettings': { 'remoteAccess': remote_access }, 'appliances': { 'applianceSize': appliance_size, 'appliances': [] }, 'vnics': { 'vnics': [] }, 'features': [] } return edge def _assemble_edge_appliance(self, resource_pool_id, datastore_id): appliance = { 'resourcePoolId': resource_pool_id, 'datastoreId': datastore_id } return appliance def _assemble_edge_vnic(self, name, index, portgroup_id, primary_address, subnet_mask, type="internal", enable_proxy_arp="false", enable_send_redirects="true", is_connected="true", mtu=1500): vnic = { 'index': index, 'name': name, 'type': type, 'portgroupId': portgroup_id, 'addressGroups': { 'addressGroups': [ { 'primaryAddress': primary_address, 'subnetMask': subnet_mask } ] }, 'mtu': mtu, 'enableProxyArp': enable_proxy_arp, 'enableSendRedirects': enable_send_redirects, 'isConnected': is_connected } return vnic def _edge_status_to_level(self, status): if status == 'GREEN': status_level = ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_ACTIVE elif status in ('GREY', 'YELLOW'): status_level = ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_DOWN else: status_level = ROUTER_STATUS_LEVEL_ERROR return status_level def get_status(self, context, edge_id): uri = vcns_const.URI_PREFIX + "/%s/status" % edge_id try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request(vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri, decode="True") status_level = self._edge_status_to_level( response['edgeStatus']) return status_level except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get edge status
response:%s"), e.response) def get_statuses(self, context): edges_status_level = {} edges = self._get_edges() for edge in edges['edgePage'].get('data'): edge_id = edge['id'] status = edge['edgeStatus'] edges_status_level[edge_id] = self._edge_status_to_level( status) bindings = self._model_query( context, nicira_models.VshieldEdgeRouterBinding).all() vse_status_level = {} for binding in bindings: vse_status_level[binding[vcns_const.ROUTER_ID]] = ( edges_status_level[binding['edge_id']]) return vse_status_level #TODO(linb): seems json synatically error, investigation in future def _update_interfaces(self, edge_id, vnics): uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][0], vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][1]) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_POST, uri, vnics) except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to config vnics
response:%s"), e.response) def get_interfaces(self, edge_id): uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][0]) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri, decode="True") return response except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get vnics
response:%s"), e.response) def create_interface(self, edge_id, name, portgroup_id, primary_address, subnet_mask, index=None): vnics = self.get_interfaces(edge_id) if index is None: index = 0 for vnic in vnics['vnics']: if vnic['isConnected'] == False: index = vnic['index'] break if index < 0 or index > vcns_const.MAX_INDEX: msg = (_("Invalid index selection %(index)d " "or exceed the quota, please ensure the index" "in range 0-%(max)d"), {"index": index, "max": vcns_const.MAX_INDEX}) LOG.exception(msg) raise q_exc.NeutronException(message=msg) vnic = self._assemble_edge_vnic( name, index, portgroup_id, primary_address, subnet_mask) vnics['vnics'][index] = vnic self.update_interface(edge_id, index, vnic) def get_interface(self, edge_id, index): uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][0], str(index)) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri, decode="True") return response except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get vnic
response: %s"), e.response) def update_interface(self, edge_id, index, vnic=None, **kwargs): vnic = self.get_interface(edge_id, index) for k, v in vnic.items(): if k in vnic: vnic[k] = v for k, v in kwargs.items(): if k in vnic: vnic[k] = v uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][0], str(index)) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_PUT, uri, vnic) except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to update vnic
response: %s"), e.response) def delete_interface(self, edge_id, index): uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['vnics'][0], str(index)) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_DELETE, uri) except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to delete vnic
response: %s"), e.response) def _deploy_edge(self, task): userdata = task.userdata lrouter = userdata['lrouter'] LOG.debug(_("Deploy Edge for router %s"), lrouter['uuid']) request = userdata['request'] uri = vcns_const.URI_PREFIX + "?async=true" try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request(vcns_const.HTTP_POST, uri, request) objuri = header['location'] job_id = objuri[objuri.rfind("/") + 1:] uri = vcns_const.URI_PREFIX + "/jobs/%s" % job_id header, response = self.vcns.do_request(vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri) edge_id = response['edgeId'] userdata['edge_id'] = edge_id status = task_const.PENDING except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException: LOG.exception(_("Task Deploy operation for router " "%s failed."), lrouter['uuid']) status = task_const.ERROR return status def _status_edge(self, task): lrouter = task.userdata['lrouter'] edge_id = task.userdata['edge_id'] LOG.debug(_("Query %s status"), edge_id) uri = vcns_const.URI_PREFIX + "/%s/status" % edge_id try: time.sleep(10) header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri, decode="True") task.userdata['retries'] = 0 systemStatus = response.get('systemStatus', None) if systemStatus is None: status = task_const.PENDING elif systemStatus == 'good': status = task_const.COMPLETED else: status = task_const.ERROR except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException: LOG.exception(_("Task status query for router " "%s failed."), lrouter['uuid']) status = task_const.ERROR except Exception: retries = task.userdata.get('retries', 0) + 1 if retries < 20: LOG.exception(_("Unable to retrieve %(edge_id)s status " "format router %(uuid)s. " "Retry %(retries)."), {'edge_id': edge_id, 'uuid_id': lrouter['uuid'], 'retries': retries}) status = task_const.PENDING else: LOG.exception(_("Unable to retrieve %(edge_id)s status " "format router %(uuid)s." "Abort."), {'edge_id': edge_id, 'uuid': lrouter['uuid']}) status = task_const.ERROR return status #enable services def _result_edge(self, task): edge_id = task.userdata['edge_id'] LOG.debug(_("Enable services on %s"), edge_id) self._enable_service_loadbalancer(edge_id) ##TODO(linb)json format synatically error, investigation in future def _update_edge(self, edge_id, edge): uri = "%s/%s" (vcns_const.URI_PREFIX, edge_id) header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_PUT, uri, edge) def _delete_edge(self, task): edge_id = task.userdata['edge_id'] status = task_const.COMPLETED if edge_id: try: uri = "%s/%s" % (vcns_const.URI_PREFIX, edge_id) header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_DELETE, uri) except VcnsApiClient.ResourceNotFound: pass except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException: LOG.exception(_("Failed to delete %(edge_id)s
" "%(response)s"), {'edge_id': edge_id, 'response': response}) status = task_const.ERROR except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Failed to delete %s"), edge_id) status = task_const.ERROR return status def _get_edge(self, edge_id): uri = "%s/%s" (vcns_const.URI_PREFIX, edge_id) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri) return response except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get edge
%s"), e.response) def _get_edges(self): uri = vcns_const.URI_PREFIX try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri) return response except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get edges
%s"), e.response) def deploy(self, context, name, jobdata): task_name = 'deploying-{}'.format(name) edge_name = 'edge-{}'.format(name) edge = self._assemble_edge(edge_name, self.datacenter_moid, appliance_size='large', remote_access='true') appliance = self._assemble_edge_appliance( self.resource_pool_id, self.datastore_id) edge['appliances']['appliances'].append(appliance) vnic_inside = self._assemble_edge_vnic( "inside", len(edge['vnics']['vnics']), self.net_inside, "169.255.2.3", "255.255.255.240", type="UPLINK") edge['vnics']['vnics'].append(vnic_inside) vnic_external = self._assemble_edge_vnic( "external", len(edge['vnics']['vnics']), self.net_external, "100.0.0.61", "255.255.255.0", type="UPLINK") edge['vnics']['vnics'].append(vnic_external) jobdata['request'] = edge jobdata['router_name'] = name lrouter = jobdata.get('lrouter') task = tasks.Task(task_name, lrouter['uuid'], self._deploy_edge, self._status_edge, self._result_edge, jobdata) task.add_executed_monitor(self.callbacks.edge_deploy_started) task.add_result_monitor(self.callbacks.edge_deploy_result) tasks.manager.add(task) def delete(self, edge_id, jobdata): jobdata['edge_id'] = edge_id task_name = 'delete-{0}'.format(edge_id) task = tasks.Task( task_name, jobdata[vcns_const.ROUTER_ID], self._delete_edge, None, None, jobdata) task.add_start_monitor(self.callbacks.edge_delete_start) task.add_result_monitor(self.callbacks.edge_delete_result) tasks.manager.add(task) def _assemble_nat_rule(action, original_address, translated_address, vnic_index=1, enabled="true"): nat_rule = {} nat_rule['action'] = action nat_rule['vnic'] = vnic_index nat_rule['originalAddress'] = original_address nat_rule['translatedAddress'] = translated_address nat_rule['enabled'] = enabled return nat_rule def get_nat_config(self, edge_id): uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][0]) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_GET, uri, decode="True") return response except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to get nat config
%s"), e.response) def create_snat_rule(self, edge_id, src, translated_ip, routes=None, **kwargs): snat_rule = self._assemble_nat_rule("snat", src, translated_ip, **kwargs) nat = self.get_nat_config(edge_id) del nat['version'] nat['rules']['natRulesDtos'].append(snat_rule) uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][0]) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_PUT, uri, nat, decode="True") #TODO(linb): update the static routers if needed except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to create snat rule
%s"), e.response) def delete_snat_rule(self, edge_id, src, routes=None, **kwargs): nat = self.get_nat_config(edge_id) del nat['version'] for nat_rule in nat['rules']['natRulesDtos']: if nat_rule['originalAddress'] == src: rule_id = nat_rule['ruleId'] uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][0], vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][1], rule_id) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_DELETE, uri) #TODO(linb): update the static routers if needed except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to delete snat rule
%s"), e.response) def create_dnat_rule(self, edge_id, dst_ip, translated_ip, **kwargs): dnat_rule = self._assemble_nat_rule("dnat", dst_ip, translated_ip, **kwargs) nat = self.get_nat_config(edge_id) nat['rules']['natRulesDtos'].append(dnat_rule) uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][0]) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_PUT, uri, nat, decode="True") except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to create dnat rule
%s"), e.response) def delete_dnat_rule(self, edge_id, translated_ip, **kwargs): nat = self.get_nat_config(edge_id) for nat_rule in nat['rules']['natRulesDtos']: if nat_rule['translatedAddress'] == translated_ip: rule_id = nat_rule['ruleId'] uri = self.build_uri_path( edge_id, vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][0], vcns_const.EDGEAPP_RESOURCES['nat'][1], rule_id) try: header, response = self.vcns.do_request( vcns_const.HTTP_DELETE, uri) except VcnsApiClient.VcnsApiException as e: LOG.exception(_("Failed to delete dnat rule
%s"), e.response) # update edge's static routes def update_lrouter_routes(self, edge_id, routes): pass # TODO(fank): update Edge's default gateway/routes def update_lrouter(self, edge_id, name, nexthop, routes=None): pass

The patch adds advanced FWaaS service support for NVP with
VCNS:
        * NVP FWaaS is an advanced Service of NVP depending on NVP
          advanced service router
            - Once an advanced router id created, one corresponding
              vshield edge will be deployed, and then we can configure
              FW service on the vshield edge
        * NVP FWaaS service plugin still uses FWaaS DB service logic,
          while finally calling vShield Edge to support FWaaS service
            - When one object is created, we will attach the object to
              the advanced router with routedserviceinsertion service
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

    Implements: blueprint nvp-fwaas-plugin

Change-Id: Id43af8821f5c553356e3cc870993eef99ef7def3

commit_message:
Support for NVP advanced FwaaS service

The patch adds advanced FWaaS service support for NVP with
VCNS:
        * NVP FWaaS is an advanced Service of NVP depending on NVP
          advanced service router
            - Once an advanced router id created, one corresponding
              vshield edge will be deployed, and then we can configure
              FW service on the vshield edge
        * NVP FWaaS service plugin still uses FWaaS DB service logic,
          while finally calling vShield Edge to support FWaaS service
            - When firewall object is created, we will attach the
              object to the advanced router with routedserviceinsertion_db
              service
        * on driver part, the driver will first convert the object
          to VSM known object input, and then send a synchronous JSON
          calling to VSM, and receive the result

Implements: blueprint nvp-fwaas-plugin
Change-Id: Id43af8821f5c553356e3cc870993eef99ef7def3

commit_message:
Fix grub/linux text mode override.

Apply a wider range of hammers to the recurring issue of images booting
with graphical consoles.

Change-Id: I96345bf8f2f13d615131557b572201b9d41b6c75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/22/47022/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i -e 's/\(^GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX.*\)"$/\1 nofb nomodeset vga=normal"/' /etc/default/grub echo 'GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="nofb nomodeset vga=normal"' >/etc/default/grubecho 'GRUB_GFXPAYLOAD_LINUX=text' >>/etc/default/grub update-grub

Better help for generate config

This just adds a sample command line for how to generate the
nova.conf.sample because I keep forgetting how to do it.

Change-Id: Id8bfb859f90d7fde51dd1ffdb40ec383ed5193e6

commit_message:
Make Instance.Name() not lazy-load things

This fixes Instance.name() to not cause lazy-loads.

Change-Id: I8fe648df8ff0f01d91685446e2b3cf5db1cbfca7
Closes-bug: 1224015

commit_message:
Document ceilometer alarm properties

This adds descriptions to the properties of OS::Ceilometer::Alarm.

Change-Id: I3851c8785c0bd94aae6412e75a02ee98ce13478b
Closes-Bug: #1224162

commit_message:
Use openstack.org git infrastructure for samples.

Updated guides to use the openstack.org git infrastructure for
retrieving sample files from the various OpenStack projects. This
prevents sporadic github outages breaking the guide builds.

Change-Id: Ic637899d2bfa4da1d64b26ef35792d9607458c51

commit_message:
Nova quota content is shared.

Nova quota content is shared between the configuration reference and the
admin user guide. The content has been moved to common and files that
point to it updated.

Change-Id: Iad80f281eb025aa93c773f3eb858e27afb9d0bdc

commit_message:
Make _provision_instances() use Quotas obj

This switches the compute api _provision_instances() method to use the
new world Quotas object.  As a result, restore() needed to be converted
as well.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Ia6f6ca47b43348074f3a579e5ab3c7e7b5ce4e38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/39987/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import quotas as quotas_obj def _check_num_instances_quota(self, context, quotas, instance_type, min_count, max_count): quotas.reserve(context, instances=max_count, cores=req_cores, ram=req_ram) return self._check_num_instances_quota(context, quotas, instance_type, return max_count def _check_metadata_properties_quota(self, context, quotas, metadata=None): quotas = quotas_obj.Quotas() num_instances = self._check_num_instances_quota( context, quotas, instance_type, min_count, max_count) quotas.rollback() # Commit the quota reservations quotas.commit()
deleted_lines: def _check_num_instances_quota(self, context, instance_type, min_count, max_count): reservations = QUOTAS.reserve(context, instances=max_count, cores=req_cores, ram=req_ram) return self._check_num_instances_quota(context, instance_type, return max_count, reservations def _check_metadata_properties_quota(self, context, metadata=None): num_instances, quota_reservations = self._check_num_instances_quota( context, instance_type, min_count, max_count) QUOTAS.rollback(context, quota_reservations) # Commit the reservations QUOTAS.commit(context, quota_reservations)

commit_message:
Initialize dependencies in extensions

The contrib extensions should be completely activated by their
inclusion in the pipeline.  However, due to the need to initialize
the managers, there was a direct reference in  a core file to two
extensions.  By delaying the resolution of the dpendencies until
after all pipelies are built, we can remove the references.

Bug 1223524

Change-Id: If9c8d3a1ad13ace45f0240edef58bcb93520687c

commit_message:
Set NoEcho: true for parameters containing secrets

This prevents secret values being returned for stack-show.

Change-Id: I82eff26fda31511b66c6371f6ded2a5fb559f3fb
Fixes-Bug: #1226730
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/47/47047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NoEcho: true NoEcho: true NoEcho: true NoEcho: true NoEcho: true

subject: Bump NODE_DISK to 20
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-17 22:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest.sh', 'devtest.md'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/949f76be5501c02a95bbd9775c7d561d194532f4', 'message': 'Bump NODE_DISK to 20

I was using NODE_DISK=10 and my undercloud ran out of disk space. This
was with Fedora images, so perhaps they are larger.

Because these are thinly provisioned qcow2 disk images, it seems
worthwhile to be generous rather than cutting it tight.

Change-Id: I9829f9e969e4c3f6e76d78231461a00b1adc6917
'}]
commit_message:
Bump NODE_DISK to 20

I was using NODE_DISK=10 and my undercloud ran out of disk space. This
was with Fedora images, so perhaps they are larger.

Because these are thinly provisioned qcow2 disk images, it seems
worthwhile to be generous rather than cutting it tight.

Change-Id: I9829f9e969e4c3f6e76d78231461a00b1adc6917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/46/47046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NODE_CPU=1 NODE_MEM=2048 NODE_DISK=20 NODE_ARCH=i386 export NODE_CPU=1 NODE_MEM=2048 NODE_DISK=20 NODE_ARCH=amd64 more than NODE_DISK, which defaults to 20GB
deleted_lines: export NODE_CPU=1 NODE_MEM=2048 NODE_DISK=10 NODE_ARCH=i386 export NODE_CPU=1 NODE_MEM=2048 NODE_DISK=15 NODE_ARCH=amd64 more than NODE_DISK, which defaults to 10GB

commit_message:
Add files to create worker RPM and get api/db/queue/worker nodes deployed.

As part of building out the Barbican network of nodes, this commit adds files
and configuration to create an RPM package for the Barbican worker nodes. Files
needed to make this work as part of a network of Barbican API, queue, worker
and database nodes are also added.

Change-Id: I87a36b7c09bbd3fec7661ce6adbcbb5b0c6df689
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/57/46157/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Barbican Worker node upstart script # Used in rpm build. Keep in sync with debian/barbican-worker.upstart description "Barbican Key Management Workers" start on runlevel [2345] stop on runlevel [06] script /usr/bin/barbican-worker end script

subject: Benchmark test framework for Rally
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-09 15:16:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/ba090fd7bc20f9cc638027e9919219e22daeb5ab', 'message': "Benchmark tests for Rally

This patch introduces the benchmark test scenarios and the corresponding
tools for their customized launching. 'rally.benchmar.test_scenarios' package
contains some sample tests that shall be used for Nova benchmarking and can
be parameterized using the appropriate test configuration.

The usage of such a test configuration allows to set benchmark parameter values
(which allows to configure, say, the number of compute nodes used in load
testing), as well as to specify the number of times each benchmark should be
launched and whether it should be launched concurrently in several threads.

Test configuration processing is provided by the further development of
TestEngine, which now also can verify the test configuration passed to its
constructor.

The patch also contains some refactoring of the Tester class which makes it
configurable through the test configuration.

Blueprint test-engine
Change-Id: Idd1296537d5a65c0b353ee9812d2e360d3c8ea39

This patch introduces the benchmark test framework for rally. The presented
framework relies heavily on the usage of test configuration files which allow
to set up which tests should be run in which order and how many times, as well
as parameterize them (e.g., to configure, say, the number of compute nodes used
in load testing). The test configuration also allows to set whether the
benchmark tests should be launched concurrently in several threads.

Test configuration processing is provided by the further development of
TestEngine, which now also can validate the test configuration passed to its
constructor.

The patch also contains some refactoring of the Tester class which makes it
configurable through the test configuration. This functionality is supported
by the TestConfigManager class, another child class of the base ConfigManager
defined in one of the previous patches.

Blueprint test-engine
Change-Id: Idd1296537d5a65c0b353ee9812d2e360d3c8ea39

commit_message:
Benchmark test framework for Rally

This patch introduces the benchmark test framework for rally. The presented
framework relies heavily on the usage of test configuration files which allow
to set up which tests should be run in which order and how many times, as well
as parameterize them (e.g., to configure, say, the number of compute nodes used
in load testing). The test configuration also allows to set whether the
benchmark tests should be launched concurrently in several threads.

Test configuration processing is provided by the further development of
TestEngine, which now also can validate the test configuration passed to its
constructor.

The patch also contains some refactoring of the Tester class which makes it
configurable through the test configuration. This functionality is supported
by the TestConfigManager class, another child class of the base ConfigManager
defined in one of the previous patches.

Blueprint test-engine
Change-Id: Idd1296537d5a65c0b353ee9812d2e360d3c8ea39

commit_message:
Add deploy-kexec element

Boots into the new image kernel once baremetal-deploy-helper signals
it is finished using kexec utilities.

Change-Id: I705787cc394ef14200d80404ee497762ab79b452

where needed.

commit_message:
Fix hyper-v vhd real size bigger than flavor issue

In hyper-v, after deploy the image, real vhd file size will be
extended from flavor size plus vhd metadata size, this patch
fix this issue by check the vhd type and minus the vhd metadata
size according to the specific vhd type.

Fixes bug #1177927

Change-Id: I51223f4f778f33e73dce1e0f53e23e8d7ac77904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/31228/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Fixed VHD size = VHD size + 512 bytes # Dynamic_VHD_size = VHD size + 1024 bytes vhd_type = base_vhd_info['Type'] if vhd_type == 'Fix': vhd_footer_size = 512 * 1024 elif vhd_type == 'Dynamic': vhd_footer_size = 1024 * 1024 else: vhd_footer_size = 0 base_vhd_size = base_vhd_info['MaxInternalSize'] root_vhd_size = instance['root_gb'] * 1024 ** 3 self._vhdutils.resize_vhd(root_vhd_path, root_vhd_size - vhd_footer_size)

CLI references are shared guides

Move CLI sections to common as they are shared between user guide, admin
user guide, and config reference guide. Update the appendix (which was
already in common) to refer to the new location.

commit_message:
Fix apache module 0.9.0 compatibility issue

The `apache` base class should be declared before any subclasses
(like `apache::mod::wsgi`) or defines (like `apache::vhost`)
because the base class does the variable initialization that the
subclasses utilize.

Fixes: bug #1226687

Change-Id: Ia1d694893d8a2e7d38769d2e43076a061e875b54
(cherry picked from commit 9a76675cd40788a8d81ab907da294f9a6698850e)

commit_message:
Register cfg options at module-level

if we register cfg options during SecureMessage.__init__
then we cannot generate nova.conf.sample. So let's move
it to the module-level

Fixes LP# 1222304

Change-Id: I4a132cfabf8f0f6deff5a9bda16584bf9c3e0be8

commit_message:
Fix error raised when router-interface-delete on no-snat routers

Previously, a 500 error would be raised trying to remove a subnet
from a no-snat router because we were trying to remove the snat
rules that didn't exist in the router.

Fixes bug: 1226323

Change-Id: Ieff0ed4bdbac39ac07e597753272a4f5d40cb346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/37/46837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If router is enabled_snat = False there are no snat rules to # delete. if router.enable_snat: self._delete_subnet_snat_rule(router, subnet)

commit_message:
Fix the order of query output for postgres

Sorts the query results and dictionary of expected results by two columns
rather than one which isn't unqiue.

Fixes bug 1208701

Change-Id: Icd21a008f7736a4d9027effb0633a506aae0f602

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-13 01:50:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/user-guide/pom.xml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/64382db86ec22fe2a8c2e9a0edccb043498de0a1', 'message': 'Remove -local from User Guide PDF file

The User Guide is build for trunk only and the Jenkins job does not

Change-Id: I9b9b0affadde2d483e4778322470d6a9e8db3cf1

commit_message:
Remove -local from User Guide PDF file

The User Guide is build for trunk only and the Jenkins job does not
set currently the release.path.name variable. Thus, the published
PDF file is called user-guide-local.pdf. Even with a changed
Jenkins job, this would be wrong, it should just be user-guide.pdf.

Change-Id: I9b9b0affadde2d483e4778322470d6a9e8db3cf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/04/46404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <pdfFilenameBase>user-guide</pdfFilenameBase>

commit_message:
Update HA Guide URLs

After changing the Jenkins job, the HA Guide now gets really
published at http://docs.openstack.org/high-availability-guide/content/

Change-Id: I2e485903dd7f6aab5f092360f005066f102c153a

commit_message:
Remove obsolete index.html files

www/.htaccess has redirects for these pages already, so nobody
will ever see them.

Change-Id: I3278a0905aaf38e5678bb87e9a8fc749684abbd8

subject: VMware: nova-compute crashes if VC not available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-18 19:08:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e21dde158c4160a8d59857ab306f1337dc2ec547', 'message': 'nova-compute crashes if VC not available.

The ESX driver gets a connection to vCenter Server on startup.  If VC is not available, nova-compute crashes.  This adds slow retry to which will fix the start up use cases of nova-compute starting before VC.  The errors are logged in case the issue is a mis-confiugration of VC

Change-Id: I0801ab4a4e4bf32b8119e131a45a2fdb7884a4fd
Fixes: bug #1192016
