commit_message:
Import validate.py from openstack-manuals

Change-Id: Ic63ec090f014112c5a4e138f6284268af67cd568
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/81/45681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
Validates all xml files against the DocBook 5 RELAX NG schema, and attempts to build all books. path Root directory, defaults to <repo root>/docRequires: - Python 2.7 or greater (for argparse) - lxml Python library - Mavenimport multiprocessingimport reFILE_EXCEPTIONS = ['st-training-guides.xml', 'ha-guide-docinfo.xml', 'bk001-ch003-associate-general.xml', 'basic-install-pom.xml'] # These are books that we aren't checking yet BOOK_EXCEPTIONS = [] RESULTS_OF_BUILDS = [] # NOTE(berendt): check_output as provided in Python 2.7.5 to make script # usable with Python < 2.7 def check_output(*popenargs, **kwargs): """Run command with arguments and return its output as a byte string. If the exit code was non-zero it raises a CalledProcessError. The CalledProcessError object will have the return code in the returncode attribute and output in the output attribute. """ if 'stdout' in kwargs: raise ValueError('stdout argument not allowed, it will be overridden.') process = subprocess.Popen(stdout=subprocess.PIPE, *popenargs, **kwargs) output, unused_err = process.communicate() retcode = process.poll() if retcode: cmd = kwargs.get("args") if cmd is None: cmd = popenargs[0] raise subprocess.CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd, output=output) return output url = "http://docbook.org/xml/5.1CR1/rng/docbookxi.rng"def verify_section_tags_have_xmid(doc): """Check that all section tags have an xml:id attribute Will throw an exception if there's at least one missing""" ns = {"docbook": "http://docbook.org/ns/docbook"} for node in doc.xpath('//docbook:section', namespaces=ns): if "{http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace}id" not in node.attrib: raise ValueError("section missing xml:id attribute, line %d" % node.sourceline) def verify_nice_usage_of_whitespaces(rootdir, docfile): """Check that no unnecessary whitespaces are used""" checks = [ re.compile(".*\s+
$"), ] elements = [ 'listitem', 'para', 'td', 'th', 'command', 'literal', 'title', 'caption', 'filename', 'userinput', 'programlisting' ] for element in elements: checks.append(re.compile(".*<%s>\s+[\w\-().:!?{}\[\]]+.*
" % element)), checks.append(re.compile(".*[\w\-().:!?{}\[\]]+\s+</%s>.*
" % element)) lc = 0 affected_lines = [] for line in open(docfile, 'r'): lc = lc + 1 for check in checks: if check.match(line) and lc not in affected_lines: affected_lines.append(str(lc)) if len(affected_lines) > 0: print ("file %s:" % os.path.relpath(docfile, rootdir)); print (" trailing or unnecessary whitespaces " "in following lines: %s" % ", ".join(affected_lines)) def get_modified_files(): try: args = ["git", "diff", "--name-only", "--relative", "HEAD", "HEAD~1"] modified_files = check_output(args).strip().split() except (CalledProcessError, OSError) as e: print("git failed: %s" % e) sys.exit(1) return modified_files def check_deleted_files(rootdir, file_exceptions): """ Check whether files got deleted and verify that no other file references them. """ print("
Checking for removed files") modified_files = get_modified_files() deleted_files = [] any_removed = False for f in modified_files: full = os.path.abspath(f) if not os.path.exists(full): print(" Removed file: %s" % f) deleted_files.append(full) any_removed = True if any_removed: # Figure out whether this file was included anywhere missing_reference = False for root, dirs, files in os.walk(rootdir): # Don't descend into 'target' subdirectories try: ind = dirs.index('target') del dirs[ind] except ValueError: pass os.chdir(root) for f in files: if (f.endswith('.xml') and f != 'pom.xml' and f not in file_exceptions): path = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(root, f)) doc = etree.parse(path) ns = {"xi": "http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude"} for node in doc.xpath('//xi:include', namespaces=ns): href = node.get('href') if (href.endswith('.xml') and os.path.abspath(href) in deleted_files): print(" File %s has an xi:include on deleted file %s " % (f, href)) missing_reference = True if missing_reference: sys.exit(1) def validate_individual_files(rootdir, exceptions, force): if force: print("
Validating all files") else: modified_files = get_modified_files() print("
Following files will be validated:") for f in modified_files: print(">>> %s" % f) modified_files = map(lambda x: os.path.abspath(x), modified_files) if (f.endswith('.xml') and f != 'pom.xml' and f not in exceptions): if not force and path not in modified_files: continue print(error_message(schema.error_log)) verify_section_tags_have_xmid(doc) verify_nice_usage_of_whitespaces(rootdir, path) print("%s: %s" % (path, e)) except ValueError as e: any_failures = True print("%s: %s" % (path, e)) if any_failures: sys.exit(1) def logging_build_book(result): RESULTS_OF_BUILDS.append(result) def build_book(rootdir, book): os.chdir(book) result = True returncode = 0 try: output = subprocess.check_output( ["mvn", "clean", "generate-sources"], stderr=subprocess.STDOUT ) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: output = e.output returncode = e.returncode result = False return (os.path.basename(book), result, output, returncode) def build_affected_books(rootdir, book_exceptions, file_exceptions, force): """Build all the books which are affected by modified files. Looks for all directories with "pom.xml" and checks if a XML file in the directory includes a modified file. If at least one XML file includes a modified file the method calls "mvn clean generate-sources" in that directory. This will throw an exception if a book fails to build """ modified_files = get_modified_files() modified_files = map(lambda x: os.path.abspath(x), modified_files) affected_books = [] books = [] book_root = rootdir for root, dirs, files in os.walk(rootdir): # Don't descend into 'target' subdirectories try: ind = dirs.index('target') del dirs[ind] except ValueError: pass if os.path.basename(root) in book_exceptions: break elif "pom.xml" in files: books.append(root) book_root = root os.chdir(root) for f in files: if (f.endswith('.xml') and f != 'pom.xml' and f not in file_exceptions): path = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(root, f)) doc = etree.parse(path) ns = {"xi": "http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude"} for node in doc.xpath('//xi:include', namespaces=ns): href = node.get('href') if (href.endswith('.xml') and f not in file_exceptions and os.path.abspath(href) in modified_files): affected_books.append(book_root) break if book_root in affected_books: break if not force and affected_books: books = affected_books else: print("No books are affected by modified files. Building all books.") maxjobs = multiprocessing.cpu_count() # Jenkins fails sometimes with errors if too many jobs run, artificially # limit to 4 for now. # See https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1221721 if maxjobs > 4: maxjobs = 4 pool = multiprocessing.Pool(maxjobs) print("Queuing the following books for building:") for book in books: print(" %s" % os.path.basename(book)) pool.apply_async(build_book, (rootdir, book), callback = logging_build_book) pool.close() print("Building all books now...") pool.join() any_failures = False for book, result, output, returncode in RESULTS_OF_BUILDS: if result: print(">>> Build of book %s succeeded." % book) else: any_failures = True print(">>> Build of book %s failed (returncode = %d)." % (book, returncode)) print("
%s" % output) if any_failures: sys.exit(1) def main(rootdir, force): if force: print("Validation of all files and build of all books will be forced.") check_deleted_files(rootdir, FILE_EXCEPTIONS) validate_individual_files(rootdir, FILE_EXCEPTIONS, force) build_affected_books(rootdir, BOOK_EXCEPTIONS, FILE_EXCEPTIONS, force) """Return the location of openstack-manuals/doc/ try: args = ["git", "rev-parse", "--show-toplevel"] gitroot = check_output(args).rstrip() except (CalledProcessError, OSError) as e: print("git failed: %s" % e) sys.exit(1) return os.path.join(gitroot, "doc") "defaults to `git rev-parse --show-toplevel`/doc/") parser.add_argument("--force", help="force the validation of all files " "and build all books", action="store_true") main(args.path, args.force)
deleted_lines: Validates all xml files against the DocBook 5 RELAX NG schema. path Root directory, defaults to <repo root>/doc/src/doc/docbkxRequires Python 2.7 or greater (for argparse) and the lxml Python library.EXCEPTIONS = ['ha-guide-docinfo.xml'] url = "http://www.docbook.org/xml/5.0/rng/docbookxi.rng"def main(rootdir): if f.endswith('.xml') and f != 'pom.xml' and f not in EXCEPTIONS: print error_message(schema.error_log) print "%s: %s" % (path, e) if any_failures: sys.exit(1) """Return the location of openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx args = ["git", "rev-parse", "--show-toplevel"] gitroot = subprocess.check_output(args).rstrip() return os.path.join(gitroot, "doc/src/docbkx") "defaults to `git rev-parse --show-toplevel`/doc/src/" "docbkx") main(args.path)

commit_message:
improved logging for debug levels

Added kwarg instance_uuid=self.id for most LOG.debug calls;
Added more contextual detail to FreshInstanceTasks to help operation
teams calculate timing for various procedures through enabling debug
logging

Change-Id: Ia0d6197fef574adcb193805804630f9c3f82c8f5

engine level.

commit_message:
Add notifiers when starting attaching/detaching of volumes

Added a notifier when starting the attaching and detaching of a volume.

Implements: add a notifier for attaching and detaching a volume
Fixes: bug #1216060

Change-Id: Ibf284d029b07ef734287cf7fe6340f4891f3d2e1

commit_message:
move net-dhcp and net-static templates to ironic/.

net-dhcp.ubuntu.template and net-static.ubuntu.template originally
under ironic/nova, now move them to ironic/. to consistent with
the definition in drivers/modules/pxe.py.

Change-Id: I6380c56c82ed1c14c1c4dadb6798e75b5d3e417e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-16 18:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/plugins/hdp/resources/ambari-config-resource.json', 'savanna/plugins/hdp/ambariplugin.py', 'savanna/plugins/hdp/savannautils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/00db2160de0647b107087e1b65c6e6eb37eab87c', 'message': 'Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb
(cherry picked from commit ebf6d4b735ffa603d132a0063c1ef3f28561ca85)

commit_message:
Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb
(cherry picked from commit ebf6d4b735ffa603d132a0063c1ef3f28561ca85)

replace "ugettext" method with "ugettext_lazy"

I do the same thing to the code which is detected by "grep" commad.

commit_message:
Merge only_www_touched change from validate.py

Do not build/check all books if only www/ is changed, instead
abort early.
This is a merge of a change only done for validate.py.

Change-Id: If81ee7c89c79e6571e2deebd98f6f596260d56c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/62/46662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check whether only files in www got updated def only_www_touched(): try: args = ["git", "diff", "--name-only", "HEAD", "HEAD~1"] modified_files = check_output(args).strip().split() except (CalledProcessError, OSError) as e: print("git failed: %s" % e) sys.exit(1) www_changed = False other_changed = False for f in modified_files: if f.startswith("www/"): www_changed = True else: other_changed = True return www_changed and not other_changed if not force and only_www_touched(): print("Only files in www directory changed, nothing to do.") return

commit_message:
Fix failure in multi-chunk state sync for nicira plugin

Bug 1224719

This patch ensures the 'result_count' attribute from NVP API responses
is properly handled, and adds support for '_page_cursor' request query
parameter in the fake nvp api client in order to ensure issues like this
are captured by unit tests.

Change-Id: I1d6179bd58a14d19729fc882f004b6d1afccbe3d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-16 23:43:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest.sh', 'devtest.md'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/0537a2a6b2616ea2cbfec91f82c675ae507c550e', 'message': 'Explicitly specify the destination dir for images

I ran ramdisk-image-create from $TRIPLE_ROOT/tripleo-incubator and then
later setup-baremetal failed to find the deploy images in $TRIPLE_ROOT
where it expected to find them.

Seems safer to always specify the destination directory for image-create
and specify the full path to the images later.

Change-Id: Ibebd6544be9cc0b1224637b365891b9b9cf40589
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly specify the destination dir for images

I ran ramdisk-image-create from $TRIPLE_ROOT/tripleo-incubator and then
later setup-baremetal failed to find the deploy images in $TRIPLE_ROOT
where it expected to find them.

Seems safer to always specify the destination directory for image-create
and specify the full path to the images later.

Change-Id: Ibebd6544be9cc0b1224637b365891b9b9cf40589

commit_message:
Convert tests to HTTPretty and reorganize

There are a lot of problems with the current means of mocking. Most
annoyingly is that we cannot differ the call to the request library by
even a single optional header or whitespace difference without breaking
the mock. HTTPretty does a better job of this because it only cares
about what is transmitted over the socket.

Rewrite tests so that they no longer do string comparisons of JSON encoded
dictionaries. This meant that they had to order the dictionary before
encoding and would fail tests where the ordering was not followed.

In the process of this I reorganized the inheritance of the
utils.TestCase object so that there is a clear separation between the
data stored on the V2 and V3 base test objects.

Change-Id: I590df65adb1d2177b4be4e016708db05131b6880

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-03 11:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/e3baba3194cdad278c614209b324f39626dac93f', 'message': 'Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

"python setup.py testr" will trigger this function to create
.testrepository if not exist.

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220149

Change-Id: I4dfcdfa5e1e323bbc7ee3add5d9d0888a42e3812
'}]
commit_message:
Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

"python setup.py testr" will trigger this function to create
.testrepository if not exist.

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220149

Change-Id: I4dfcdfa5e1e323bbc7ee3add5d9d0888a42e3812
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/50/44850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: function init_testr { if [ ! -d .testrepository ]; then ${wrapper} testr init fi }init_testr

commit_message:
Use full namespace in variables in heat.conf

The migration to the single heat.conf broke references to
metadata_server_url and others, resulting in a completely broken
heat.conf.

Change-Id: Ie68c49d5b9bddbeacfb306c05cfeea70b973e433

commit_message:
Allow packet forwarding for Fedora.

By default, Fedora iptables is configured to reject forwarded packets.
This prevents connecting from the host to the undercloud via the seed
node when following the devtest.md instructions.

Change-Id: I45ae465deb03ff8e45f05b16159098770293d04d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/30/46830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Delete the rule that was blocking packet forwarding. iptables -D FORWARD -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited

Assume scripts are in $PATH

We're still running some scripts with the full path specified for some
scripts which are in $PATH.

Also remove unused $BASE vars from a few places.

Change-Id: I4bf7495ff5e5206d451b6675e544126d57a9c055

commit_message:
Force pseudo-tty allocation for ssh.

"ssh $HOST sudo ..." will fail if sudo is configured to require a tty
as it is on Fedora.  Use the -t argument to ssh to force a psuedo-tty.

Change-Id: I51dd364ad3c5e8ad793637896bf77137faa0ddff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/36/46836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssh -t $HOST sudo /opt/stack/venvs/keystone/bin/keystone-manage pki_setup --keystone-user keystone --keystone-group keystone

commit_message:
Fail setup-baremetal if no deploy images exist

Use 'set -o pipefail' to ensure that if glance image-create fails
because, for example, the deploy kernel and ramdisk doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I7700f8d5233cde35bba2831b63929ca5f4bde1c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/34/46834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -o pipefail

subject: Fixed a PyPy compatibility issue in the test fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-14 17:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/keystone_data.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f359c66e09a3de5f7f26d39a7f4b0e89214a5919', 'message': "Fixed a PyPy compatibility issue in the test fixtures

This construct didn't work under PyPy, as a result of the fact that
datetime is implemented in Python in PyPy:

A simplification of the problem is this:

import datetime

class X(datetime.datetime):
    pass

now = datetime.datetime.now()
X.isoformat(now)

This works under CPython, but fails under PyPy. This is because PyPy
creates a normal unbound method for `X.isoformat`, which checks that
`now` is an instance of `X`, which it isn't. Because datetime is
implemented in C, CPython skips those checks.

Change-Id: Id27e7a8b00156bd9688bdb36d2c38b04785c2d0c
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a PyPy compatibility issue in the test fixtures

This construct didn't work under PyPy, as a result of the fact that
datetime is implemented in Python in PyPy:

A simplification of the problem is this:

import datetime

class X(datetime.datetime):
    pass

now = datetime.datetime.now()
X.isoformat(now)

This works under CPython, but fails under PyPy. This is because PyPy
creates a normal unbound method for `X.isoformat`, which checks that
`now` is an instance of `X`, which it isn't. Because datetime is
implemented in C, CPython skips those checks.

Change-Id: Id27e7a8b00156bd9688bdb36d2c38b04785c2d0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/27/46627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: expiration = tomorrow.isoformat()

commit_message:
Ensure that qpid connection is closed (from oslo)

This is commit a9bc62814d in oslo-incubator

Fixes bug 1172922

When reestablishing a session and a connection already exists the
existing connection will be closed prior to opening the new one.

Change-Id: I9a25800fe4b56eba89d550e3461ce095bf902f0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/13/43713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Close the session if necessary if self.connection.opened(): try: self.connection.close() except qpid_exceptions.ConnectionError: pass
deleted_lines: if self.connection.opened(): try: self.connection.close() except qpid_exceptions.ConnectionError: pass

commit_message:
Store user settings in persistent cookies as well as the session

This should keep international users from having to reset their
language preferences every time they login.

Fixes Bug: 1225250

Change-Id: I093e7a98085bf83890b295ec4a61f839b60db4db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/46591/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LANGUAGE_COOKIE_NAME = 'horizon_language'
